title: UX DESIGNER VIKARIAT 1 ÅR
description:
**FÖRETAG**


Stena Recycling Group

**PLATS**


Göteborg, Sverige

**SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDATUM**


2025-09-14

**YRKESOMRÅDE**


Business



  
We are looking for a passionate UX designer who will be an important part of our Sales & Marketing Domain within Business Digital. It starts with you!



You will take on an active role in improving the end-user experience of our digital products and services. You consult with stakeholders to better understand their needs and goals, conduct usability testing, create digital product prototypes, and conduct user analyses. You understand what drives people to take the actions they do and learn from that information to create a seamless and satisfying user experience.



As part of the product teams, you will help build and continuously improve digital products for the logged-in customer at Stena Recycling Group, always by putting customer and user experience at the center. With digital technology you will help drive growth and revenue as an addition to the traditional business.


**Meet the team!**



We are three product teams that together develop Stena Recycling's customer portal - a service used by thousands of customers in five countries. You will work closely with our product owners: Lars and Karolina - and become an important part of a UX team that, together with the developers, drives the agile work forward to provide Stena's customers with digital services and the best possible user experience. We want to both deliver value and have fun along the way. We are located at the top of Stena Metal's building, with a relaxed atmosphere and space for both work focus and ping pong matches. With us, you will have plenty of space to understand the users' needs and translate them into prototypes and final design. We look forward to meeting you!


**Using your potential, you will:**


* Conduct user research to understand user needs
* Develop user journeys and other user-centered artifacts to illustrate insights and guide design decisions
* Develop wireframes and prototypes around customer needs
* Design intuitive interaction flows and ensuring usability
* Collaborate in cross-functional teams
* Continuously test, iterate and improve user experience
* Keep up to date with industry trends


**It starts with you!**



We are seeking a UX designer who is/has:


* Problem-solving attitude
* Interested in being part of the circular economy
* Enjoys working in dynamic teams centered around innovation and digital acceleration
* A team player with great communication skills in both Swedish and English, verbally and written
* Action oriented with delivery focus and a can-do attitude.
* Curious, empathetic, asks insightful questions, listens to and acts on feedback to ensure the end-user has a seamless experience.


You also have:


* BSc in Design, Computer Science or a related field
* Proven experience as a UX Designer or similar role
* Proficient in Figma design software or similar
* A strong portfolio of design projects
* Knowledge of interaction design, information architecture and data visualization
* Experience working in product teams
* Experience working with user research

  
**ANSÖKAN**
-----------


Hope we have caught your attention. Join our ride today and help us, by using your potential, to make a difference and form a sustainable tomorrow! We look forward to your application as soon as possible, selection will be running continuously. We do background check in the recrutment process.  

  

**Sista ansökningsdatum:**  

2025-09-14
Vill du veta mer?
Om du har frågor om denna specifika tjänst är du välkommen att kontakta oss. För allmän information om hur det är att arbeta för Stena Metallkoncernen, besök vår karriärsida.


**CHRISTINA JOHANSSON**
Rekryteringsspecialist

**010 445 8613**
**DATASKYDDSDEKLARATION**
-------------------------


Stena Metall AB har åtagit sig att skydda och respektera din integritet. Vi vill att du ska känna dig trygg när vi behandlar dina personuppgifter. För att säkerställa en hög skyddsnivå för de personuppgifter du delar med oss kommer vi inte att behandla de ansökningar som skickas till oss via e-post. Skicka in din ansökan enligt instruktionerna.

title: Compliance Coordinator
description:
Vi söker nu för kunds räkning en Compliance Coordinator till kundens R&D- och Engineering-team i Göteborg. I rollen blir du en nyckelperson i att säkerställa att produkter uppfyller gällande direktiv och regelverk – och därigenom bidra direkt till framtida produktutveckling.

**ROLLBESKRIVNING**


Som Compliance Coordinator kommer du att:

  

* Säkerställa efterlevnad av produktrelaterade lagar och direktiv, såsom Maskindirektivet, EMC, RED, LVD, REACH, RoHS och Conflict Minerals etc.
* Bedöma legala och regulatoriska krav ur ett produktutvecklingsperspektiv, och se till att produktportföljen lever upp till dessa.
* Utveckla och samordna compliance-program för kundens produkter.
* Samarbeta med säljorganisationen kring överlämning av compliance-dokumentation för standardprodukter, som sedan används i kundprojekt.
* Arbeta nära interna intressenter för att integrera compliance-åtgärder i verksamheten.
* Hålla utbildningar och workshops för relevanta kollegor och öka kunskapen kring compliance i hela organisationen.


**KVALIFIKATIONER**

  

Vi letar inte efter anställda, vi letar efter medarbetare – efter ESSIQ:are! Nedanstående är de grundläggande kvalifikationerna för tjänsten, men vi kommer även lägga stor vikt vid din personlighet.

**Grundläggande kvalifikationer**


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet som **Compliance Coordinator** eller i en liknande compliance-roll.
* Mycket god **analytisk** förmåga, struktur och problemlösningsförmåga.
* Förmåga att arbeta **självständigt**, prioritera och driva flera uppgifter parallellt.
* Stark **kommunikativ** förmåga och förmågan att anpassa dig till olika intressenter.
* Flytande **engelska** i tal och skrift (svenska är meriterande).
* Möjlighet att **resa** till kundens enheter i Italien, Polen och vid behov Nordamerika.
* 

**Personlighet och engagemang**

* Du är **ansvarstagande** – kommer i mål, i medvind likväl som i motvind.
* Du är **social och kommunikativ** – öppen och tydlig gentemot dina kollegor, och är en produktiv problemlösare. Du är bra på att föra samtal om dig, arbetsteamet och leveransen inför en eller flera åhörare.
* Du är **lyhörd och hjälpsam** – tar in kunskap från omvärld och kollegor, och delar gärna med dig av din egen. Du är generös med tips, hjälp och stöd.

**OM TJÄNSTEN**

* Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning på heltid. 6 månaders provanställning tillämpas.
* Tillträde: enligt överenskommelse.
* Lön och förmåner: Konkurrenskraftig fast eller rörlig lön. Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och generösa förmåner. Tjänstepension, omfattande försäkringar.
* Placering: ESSIQ Väst – Göteborg med omnejd.

**OM ESSIQ**  

ESSIQ är teknikkonsultföretaget där allt börjar med dig. Med fokus på individen, flexibla lösningar och en modern lönepolicy attraherar vi de skarpaste, mest professionella och engagerade personerna i branschen. Med denna vision grundades ESSIQ år 2005, sedan dess har vi utvecklats till ett framgångsrikt företag med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö. Vi består idag av över 150 medarbetare med olika bakgrund, personlighet och nationalitet, med en god fördelning av kvinnor och män.


Vi har över 80 aktiva kunder i spännande branscher – allt från de stora aktörerna till de små innovationsföretagen. ESSIQ:s medarbetare arbetar med användarcentrerad tjänste- och produktutveckling inom följande tjänsteområden: UX & Service Design, Connected & Embedded Systems, IT & Cloud Services, Green Technology & Electromobility, Test & Quality Engineering, Agile Management, Mechanical Engineering samt Simulation & Visualization. Kompetensen levererar vi på plats hos uppdragsgivaren, inhouse och i satellit. Våra medarbetares intressen och ambitioner leder vägen – vårt mål är att göra den perfekta matchningen av individ och uppdrag.


ESSIQ är ett familjärt och socialt företag med visionen att vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för alla medarbetare, oavsett roll i organisationen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid gemenskap och har ett uppskattat utbud av professionella och sociala aktiviteter. Vår kommunikationsplattform genomsyras av öppenhet, och främjar nätverkande och kompetensutbyte såväl som fritidsaktiviteter och relationsbyggande.

**ANSÖKAN**  

Ansök snarast då behovet är omgående och intervjuer kommer att ske löpande.


**KONTAKT**  

Frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta: petra.govik@essiq.se  

Vill du veta mer om ESSIQ?  

Besök http://essiq.se och följ oss på våra sociala medier!

title: Experienced UI Artist - Hearts of Iron
description:
### **Role Overview**


As an Experienced UI Artist on *Hearts of Iron IV*, you’ll craft the visual language that guides players through one of the most complex and immersive grand strategy games on the market. You’ll work closely with the content designers, UX designers, art director, and programmers to design, implement, and polish user interface elements that are both functional and evocative of the game’s WWII setting.

### **Key Re****sponsibilities**

* **Visual Design & Implementation**
	+ Create high-quality UI elements, icons, event illustrations, and other 2D assets.
	+ Develop and maintain the game’s visual identity for menus, HUDs, and in-game overlays.
	+ Implement and optimize UI assets in the game engine for performance and clarity.
* **Collaboration & Iteration**
	+ Work closely with content designers to bring the features and country packs to life.
	+ Partner with UX designers to ensure usability and player-friendly navigation.
	+ Work with programmers to integrate UI features while maintaining design intent.
	+ Work with outsourcing partners to help deliver consistent quality on time.
	+ Solicit peer reviews and feedback.
* **Creative Problem-Solving**
	+ Adapt designs to support new gameplay features and country expansions.
	+ Maintain consistency across the base game and multiple DLC’s.

### **Requirements**

* Strong portfolio demonstrating hand-painted digital art skills and a keen eye for typography, composition, and color.
* Working experience designing UI from concept to final implementation.
* Understanding of UX principles and ability to collaborate with UX specialists.
* Moderate scripting skills for UI integration.
* Comfortable using English in spoken and written form.

### **Bonus Skills**

* Familiarity with After Effects and 3D software.
* Passion for Paradox’s grand strategy titles or modding and interest in historical themes.
* Skills in CSS, Actionscript, Javascript and HTML.

  

In *Hearts of Iron IV*, the UI isn’t just a layer on top of gameplay — it’s the command center for global strategy. Your work will directly shape how players plan invasions, manage resources, and rewrite history.


Your art will be seen for hundreds of hours by devoted fans across the globe, becoming part of the living history they create.


As part of the recruitment process, you may be asked to perform a test.

This role is about more than crafting interfaces; you’ll work across the full spectrum of design, from brand expression and user experience to conversion optimisation. At the same time, you’ll act as an e-commerce consultant for our clients, providing guidance and expertise on best practices, strategy, and innovation to create real customer value and business impact.

 As a UX/UI Designer at Grebban, you will design seamless, conversion-driven user journeys that are deeply rooted in brand and design excellence. You’ll collaborate closely with clients, developers, and fellow designers to create flows, prototypes, and final designs that inspire, perform, and deliver measurable value.

title: UX Intern
description:
**Are you our next UX Intern?**
 We are looking for someone passionate about growing their UX skills while working alongside one of our UX-Designers. You will be working with design, make and test out prototypes and create the end-product of the future digital touch points for our customers.
   

  

 You are driven, curious and gets motivated by collaboration.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* You have started a UX related education
* You understand UX principles and methods
* You have some previous experience with Figma
* You have a basic understanding of how to work with design systems
* You are creative and like to find new creative solutions for our customers
* You have some business understanding, ability to translate business needs into concrete requirements and design solutions


**A plus if you:**
* Have previous work experience


**If UX Community**
 You will spend your everyday alongside one of our designers, but besides that you will be a part of the If Experience Design Community, which consists of 55+ skilled and engaged designers. We all work with the digital services and touch points for If customers. We design digital services for the full customer journey; learning about and buying insurances, onboarding, being insured and helping our customers recover from an accident or other types of loss. We are many designers at If and we think the best way to learn and improve is by sharing with one another - this is the backbone of our Experience Design Community.
   

  

**Working at If**
 Get the opportunity to work in one of the largest insurance companies in the Nordics. We enable almost four million customers to live their fullest lives by always being by their side if something unexpected happens. Insurance is all about life and creating great customer journeys. And it’s all about the user experience!
   

  

 We offer you a workplace with engaged colleagues who contribute with visions and goals that maximize our customer experience. You will be a part of an inspiring workplace where we value flexibility, work-life balance, and believe in you.
   

  

 We have offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, and the Baltics.
   

  

**Additional Facts And The Recruitment Process**
**Application deadline:** 
 Screening and interviewing will start immediately. However, deadline to apply is September 14.
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 please attach CV, personal letter and portfolio.
   

**Work location:** 
 Stockholm (Bergshamra)
   

  

**Start:** 
 End of 2025
   

  

**For more information, please contact:**
**Signe Bennmarker, Designer at If,** 
 signe.bennmarker@if.se
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: UX/UI Designer with Frontend Development Skills
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we create world-class gaming products with bold, uncompromising design and unmatched attention to detail. We're looking for a UX/UI Designer who doesn't just stop at the design phase — you also bring your ideas to life in code.
 



  





 You'll join a cross-functional product team with full ownership over the solutions you design, working on innovative and highly interactive user experiences seen by players around the world. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers to bring your ideas to life—creating products that are both beautiful and usable. Depending on your experience, you might implement parts of the frontend yourself or work alongside developers to ensure your vision is realized in the final product.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Lead UX and UI design efforts for new and existing products — from user flows and wireframes to high-fidelity mockups.
* Translate your designs into functional, responsive, and accessible frontend components using React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Partner with developers and stakeholders to iterate on solutions, run experiments, and refine interfaces based on user feedback and performance data.
* Build and maintain components in a shared design system, ensuring consistency and scalability across products.
* Advocate for user-centered design throughout the product development process.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have a strong background in UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing thoughtful, elegant interfaces and interaction design.
* Are fluent in modern design tools like Figma, and enjoy prototyping and testing user flows.
* Know how to write clean, maintainable frontend code using React and TypeScript.
* Are comfortable working with developers and understand how design decisions impact performance and implementation.
* Care deeply about usability, accessibility, and the overall user experience.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where experimentation is encouraged.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Familiarity with A/B testing, analytics, and data-driven design decisions.
* An understanding of game or entertainment product design patterns.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* Figma (or other tools you prefer) / Design Systems
* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 You don't need to know everything from day one. If you're a designer who loves to get your hands dirty in code, and you're passionate about crafting exceptional user experiences, we'd love to meet you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and help shape the future of interactive entertainment.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Digital UX/UI Designer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking audio innovation. We are home to Marshall, Natal Drums, Urbanears and adidas headphones.
   

  

 For over sixty years, we’ve amplified the sound of the world’s most talented artists. We’ve brought their music to crowds and solo listeners everywhere. We give sound a design that resonates with ears and eyes, as well as at a deeper cultural level. No matter the scene or music genre, we aim to excite, intrigue and surprise.
   

  

 Bridging iconic rock ‘n’ roll heritage with cutting-edge innovation and culture-driven brand-building, our group activities span professional music equipment, consumer electronics, live events, a record label, and more.
   

  

 We empower around 800 highly talented people across 8 global locations. Our products are sold in over 90 markets worldwide, totalling a combined annual turnover of USD 360 million.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our UX/UI team with another experienced digital designer who will focus on delivering screen-based interactions for our next generation of companion apps.
   

  

 The UX/UI team is part of a bigger design team with Interaction and Industrial designers and Design Researchers, all led by a team of Design Leaders giving direction and prioritising projects.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 You will join a team of 4-5 Digital UX/UI and Interaction Designers of various seniority levels. As a team, you will implement app design solutions in collaboration with our software team for both iOS and Android. As a Digital UX/UI you will be collaborating with stakeholders to understand app requirements, develop wireframes and prototypes to communicate design vision, and implement consistent interaction design across platforms.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**
* Create both high-level design concepts and detailed app user flows with a combined focus on functionality, scalability, and appealing visual design.
* Build app prototypes that emphasize and explain your concepts or respond to product briefs with consideration for the functional transition and interplay between software and hardware.
* Implement design solutions in collaboration with our software and firmware team for iOS and Android.
* Support the development of digital UX/UI principles and continue to grow our digital design system.
* Collaborate with our user insights team to collect and analyze user insights.
* Plan design activities for your projects in collaboration with the leaders in the Design team.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are an experienced designer with a palette of both UX and UI skills and competencies and see yourself as a people-oriented, team player and a strong relationship builder. You have a solid understanding of the digital product design process and are used to working in agile settings. You have a can-do attitude driven by your curiosity and creativity. You keep your eyes on the target and you can work conceptually and collaborate with others to build awesome products. You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills as you will discuss and explain design options with many different stakeholders. Experience in product development and software projects is crucial. Additionally, we value people-oriented individuals who are team players and have a passion for personal and team growth. With exceptional communication skills, you also understand the power of giving and receiving feedback to elevate the team's creative output and have the necessary skills to do so.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* 4 + years experience as a UX/UI Designer or similar role.
* Experience delivering successful digital product design for both iOS and Android apps.
* Experience within Figma and experience in using agile tools and methodologies.
* Experience in designing interactive physical/digital products and hence ability to navigate in a hybrid product development setup for software.
* Experience working with, and evolving, design systems.
* Minimum bachelor’s degree in design/human-computer interaction or other related education.
* Working proficiency in English, both spoken and written
* You understand the different aspects of product development and complex software and design projects.
* You can maintain strong production abilities in high complexity and are structured and thorough in your daily work.
* Exceptional communication skills.


 Bonus: experience designing for the Bluetooth stack and the ability to navigate in a hybrid product development setup for hardware is a high priority.
   

  

**What does hybrid remote mean for us?**
 Hybrid remote for us means working in the country listed within the job advert with 2+ days in the office (depending on what the position or project requires).
   

  

**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Product Designer Casino
description:
**ComeOn Group in short**
 Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Operating more than 20 brands on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.
   

  

**The Team**
 Our design team is growing, and we're currently searching for new members. We want our new player to be passionate about quality user interfaces and awesome user experiences.
   

  

 We are a team of 8 designers with multiple nationalities who love what we do and have fun doing it! We are on an exciting journey to invent the future of iGaming.
   

  

**Position Description & Responsibilities**
 Your job will be to turn user and business goals into seamless and intuitive web and mobile user experiences.
   

  

* Own product design for our Casino and Live Casino experience
* Work closely with Product Owners and Engineers, advocate for user needs and product quality
* Design wireframes, user flows and interactive prototypes to explore and demonstrate concepts to the rest of the team and stakeholders
* Collaborate with the rest of the product design team on company-wide initiatives, our shared design system, guidelines etc
* Stay on top of the latest industry trends


 Check out our amazing brands here: https://wearecomeon.com/our-brands/
   

  

**Requirements**
* 4+ years of work experience in UX and UI design, with a strong portfolio showcasing impactful, user-centered work.
* 1+ year of hands-on experience in the online gambling industry.
* A deep understanding of UX principles and how to translate them into intuitive, delightful user journeys.
* Figma expert, confident in maintaining and evolving a design system.
* Strong storytelling and presentation skills—able to clearly communicate design decisions, goals, and their business impact.
* A true team player with a positive, collaborative mindset, thriving in fast-paced environments


**Nice to have**
* Experience designing multi-brand, multi-market platforms.
* A data-driven approach to design, using insights to guide decisions.
* Skilled in preparing and running UX workshops, usability testing, and research.
* Ability to bring interfaces to life with animations and micro-interactions.
* Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript


**Benefits**
**So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?**
 ComeOn offers a competitive and consistent benefits package for our team members. While some benefits vary by location due to local needs and regulations, many are available company-wide, and we're proud to offer them to everyone:
   

  

* Fantastic quarterly or half-yearly team events
* Regular company events
* A 250 euro One-time Hybrid Allowance to help you set up your home office (or equivalent in local currency)
* Annual wellbeing allowance/ gym membership (location dependent)
* 40 days ‘Work from Another Location' (WFAL) entitlement to work from any other location around the world
* Regular Meals at the office


 At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.
   

  

 At ComeOn Group, we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assessing candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.
   

  

 Want to know more about us? Just visit any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!
   

  

* LinkedIn
* Instagram
* Glassdoor

title: User Experience Designer
company_industry: Graphic Design, Design Services, and Audio and Video Equipment Manufacturing
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking audio innovation. We are home to Marshall, Natal Drums, Urbanears and adidas headphones.
 



  





 For over sixty years, we’ve amplified the sound of the world’s most talented artists. We’ve brought their music to crowds and solo listeners everywhere. We give sound a design that resonates with ears and eyes, as well as at a deeper cultural level. No matter the scene or music genre, we aim to excite, intrigue and surprise.
 



  





 Bridging iconic rock ‘n’ roll heritage with cutting-edge innovation and culture-driven brand-building, our group activities span professional music equipment, consumer electronics, live events, a record label, and more.
 



  





 We empower around 800 highly talented people across 8 global locations. Our products are sold in over 90 markets worldwide, totalling a combined annual turnover of USD 360 million.
 



  





**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our UX/UI team with another experienced digital designer who will focus on delivering screen-based interactions for our next generation of companion apps.
 



  





 The UX/UI team is part of a bigger design team with Interaction and Industrial designers and Design Researchers, all led by a team of Design Leaders giving direction and prioritising projects.
 



  





**What you’ll do:** 




 You will join a team of 4-5 Digital UX/UI and Interaction Designers of various seniority levels. As a team, you will implement app design solutions in collaboration with our software team for both iOS and Android. As a Digital UX/UI you will be collaborating with stakeholders to understand app requirements, develop wireframes and prototypes to communicate design vision, and implement consistent interaction design across platforms.
 



  





**Roles & Responsibilities:** 



* Create both high-level design concepts and detailed app user flows with a combined focus on functionality, scalability, and appealing visual design.
* Build app prototypes that emphasize and explain your concepts or respond to product briefs with consideration for the functional transition and interplay between software and hardware.
* Implement design solutions in collaboration with our software and firmware team for iOS and Android.
* Support the development of digital UX/UI principles and continue to grow our digital design system.
* Collaborate with our user insights team to collect and analyze user insights.
* Plan design activities for your projects in collaboration with the leaders in the Design team.



  





**Who we’re looking for:** 




 You are an experienced designer with a palette of both UX and UI skills and competencies and see yourself as a people-oriented, team player and a strong relationship builder. You have a solid understanding of the digital product design process and are used to working in agile settings. You have a can-do attitude driven by your curiosity and creativity. You keep your eyes on the target and you can work conceptually and collaborate with others to build awesome products. You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills as you will discuss and explain design options with many different stakeholders. Experience in product development and software projects is crucial. Additionally, we value people-oriented individuals who are team players and have a passion for personal and team growth. With exceptional communication skills, you also understand the power of giving and receiving feedback to elevate the team's creative output and have the necessary skills to do so.
 



  





**You probably have the following experiences & skills:** 



* 4 + years experience as a UX/UI Designer or similar role.
* Experience delivering successful digital product design for both iOS and Android apps.
* Experience within Figma and experience in using agile tools and methodologies.
* Experience in designing interactive physical/digital products and hence ability to navigate in a hybrid product development setup for software.
* Experience working with, and evolving, design systems.
* Minimum bachelor’s degree in design/human-computer interaction or other related education.
* Working proficiency in English, both spoken and written
* You understand the different aspects of product development and complex software and design projects.
* You can maintain strong production abilities in high complexity and are structured and thorough in your daily work.
* Exceptional communication skills.



 Bonus: experience designing for the Bluetooth stack and the ability to navigate in a hybrid product development setup for hardware is a high priority.
 



  





**What does hybrid remote mean for us?** 




 Hybrid remote for us means working in the country listed within the job advert with 2+ days in the office (depending on what the position or project requires).
 



  





**Our pledge:** 




 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
 



  





 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
 



  





**Does this sound like you?** 




 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
**Shape the future of Entertainment in the Nordics** 




  





 Telenor is building the next generation TV and streaming experiences for customers in Norway, Sweden, and Finland. We're now looking for a Senior UX Designer who is passionate about user insight, product consistency, and hands-on design execution to join our multinational team
 



  





 This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of design, product, and technology—where your work will directly shape how Nordic customers discover and enjoy content across screens and services.
 



  





**Your mission:** 



* Lead UX design delivery for the Nordic TV & Streaming product
* Own the full design lifecycle: from insight and hypothesis, through ideation and prototyping, to testing and implementation.
* Translate user insight into actionable improvements—gathering data through interviews, analytics, observations, and usability testing.
* Facilitate workshops with users, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams.
* Collaborate across Norway, Sweden, and Finland to align market needs—transforming local perspectives into shared, insight-driven solutions.
* Work closely with our supplier’s UX team, who design core platform components—while taking responsibility for implementing feature changes through our internal configuration dashboard.



  





**Who you are:** 



* A senior UX generalist who thrives in complex product environments.
* Strategic and hands-on. Comfortable taking ownership from early discovery through to hands-on implementation.
* Insight-led. You challenge assumptions with data and customer perspectives.
* Curious and collaborative. You enjoy working across countries, disciplines, and supplier teams.
* Unafraid of legacy thinking but skilled at bringing others with you through facilitation and user advocacy.



  





**What you’ll bring:** 



* 5+ years of experience in UX design, interaction design, or service design roles.
* Experience working in multidisciplinary product teams with developers and product managers.
* Strong skills in insight gathering, concept development, prototyping, and testing.
* Fluency in Figma and other relevant design tools.
* Experience leading or facilitating workshops and design processes.
* Understanding of how to work with and contribute to a design system.
* A keen eye for interaction and visual consistency.
* Comfortable adjusting product settings directly in dashboards, CMS-like tools, or admin panels.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
* Experience working across markets or in large, distributed organizations is a plus.
* Knowledge of accessibility and inclusive design principles is an advantage.
* Nordic language skills are a bonus but not required.



  





**Why join us?** 




 At Telenor, you’ll play a key role in shaping one of our most exciting customer offerings—TV and streaming that meets the needs of today’s viewers. You’ll be part of a product team with real influence and responsibility, and get to work across three countries in an environment that supports flexibility, curiosity, and collaboration.
 



  





**Practical details** 



* Application deadline: 07.09.2025. We will review applications as they come in.
* Workplace: Oslo, Helsinki or Stockholm (occasional travel)
* Portfolio: Please include a portfolio showing 1–2 case studies that demonstrate how you’ve used insights to shape design and deliver value.
* Contact: For questions about the position, reach out to Jette Overgaard at jette.overgaard@telenor.no (+004792020458).



  





**Diversity & inclusion at Telenor** 




 We believe diverse teams make better products. Telenor is committed to building a workforce that reflects our customer base. We welcome applicants regardless of gender, age, nationality, religion, disability, or
 



 background.

title: Ux-designer (vikariat) inom digitala tjänster till Stockholm
description:
Placeringsort StockholmDiarienummer FK 2025/019277
   

  

 Logga in och sök jobbet Öppnas i nytt fönster
   

  

*Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan cirka 20 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 250 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför sätter vi oss in i varje ärende, följer lagar och regler, informerar och vägleder, bryr oss och visar omtanke. Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar. Välkommen till Försäkringskassan.*
 Vi söker en ux-designer (verksamhetsutvecklare) till IT-avdelningens enhet Digital användarupplevelse, inom området Digitalt kundmöte, som ansvarar för strategi och utveckling av digitala tjänster för Försäkringskassans kunder samt säkerställa en sammanhållen användarupplevelse i våra externa och interna digitala kanaler. Tjänsten är ett vikariat på 1 år.
   

  

 Ux-design, verksamhetsutveckling, digitala tjänster
   

  

 Vi söker en ux-designer till IT-avdelningens enhet Digital användarupplevelse, inom området Digitalt kundmöte, som ansvarar för strategi och utveckling av digitala tjänster för Försäkringskassans kunder samt säkerställa en sammanhållen användarupplevelse i våra externa och interna digitala kanaler. Tjänsten är ett vikariat på ett år.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med användardriven digital tjänsteutveckling för att tillgodose användarnas behov och effektivisera vår verksamhet. Involvering av slutanvändare genom hela designprocessen är centralt för vårt arbetssätt. Som ux-designer arbetar du tätt med våra andra designresurser och övriga utvecklingsresurser samt intressenter för att säkerställa användarens behov i våra digitala tjänster.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i hela designprocessen, från kartläggning av användarnas behov, konceptualisering, till detaljerad interaktionsdesign. Du deltar också i arbetet med att följa upp och förbättra våra tjänster genom att planera och genomföra användartester och mätningar samt analys av förbättringar.
   

  

 Som medarbetare hos oss hanterar du sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som arbetar hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har högskoleexamen eller erfarenheter och kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga
* agerar på eget initiativ och tar ansvar för att nå goda resultat
* samarbetar effektivt med andra för att nå gemensamma mål
* har god kommunikativ förmåga
* har goda kunskaper i svenska, i tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* har kunskaper i analysverktyg (vi använder för tillfället Matomo)
* har erfarenhet av att kombinera kvantitativ och kvalitativ research
* har kunskap om researcharbete inom digital tillgänglighet och inkluderande design
* har erfarenhet av arbete i agila organisationer.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 En tjänst, vikariat ett år, heltid, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Försäkringskassan kan komma att göra viss ekonomisk personkontroll innan anställning. I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering. Placeringsort: Stockholm (Telefonplan).
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassan som arbetsgivare? Besök www.forsakringskassan.se/jobbahososs.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Chef: Martin Sundman, 010-116 91 81 (för frågor om tjänsten). HR-specialist: Mats Törngren, 010-113 44 13, mats.torngren@fk.se (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen). Fackliga representanter är för ST Christina Lövgren, Saco-S Ann Wiström och Seko Johanna Grundström. Dessa nås via vår växel 08-786 90 00.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 5 september 2025. Ladda gärna upp dina examensbevis, betyg och intyg i samband med din ansökan.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter eller ingen tillgång till bank-id ringer du den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi ska i allt vi gör, agera med utgångspunkt i principen om alla människors lika värde, rättssäkerhet och med god service till medborgarna.

title: Product & Software Engineering - Intern
description:
Product & Software Engineering Interns – Build the Future of Modular AI Tech
 



 Are you passionate about designing and building the next generation of consumer technology?
 



 Arfve is looking for Product and Software Engineers to join our Industrial Design & Development Team, helping turn modular, AI-powered consumer tech concepts into real, functional products.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As an engineering intern at Arfve, you will:
 



 • Collaborate closely with Industrial Designers to develop prototypes and product features.
 



 • Contribute to both hardware and software aspects of our modular products.
 



 • Help optimize functionality, user experience, and modularity in early-stage designs.
 



 • Participate in fast-paced ideation sessions, solving real-world engineering challenges.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




 • 12–16 weeks of hands-on experience in a forward-thinking tech startup.
 



 • Full remote setup with close collaboration with international teams.
 



 • Mentorship from product, hardware, and software experts.
 



 • A clear path toward paid roles for high-performing contributors.
 



  





**Who We’re Looking For** 




 • Students or early-career engineers in product design, embedded systems, software, or hardware development.
 



 • Problem-solvers with curiosity and a passion for modular, AI-powered tech.
 



 • Team players who thrive in collaborative, fast-moving, and experimental environments.
 



 • Individuals ready to take initiative and contribute meaningfully to innovative product development.
 



  





**About Arfve** 




 Arfve is on a mission to redefine consumer technology by creating products that are modular, intelligent, and built to last. We aim to lead a shift toward sustainable, user-driven tech innovation.
 



**Details** 




 • Type: Unpaid Internship (with path to paid roles)
 



 • Duration: 12–16 weeks
 



 • Location: Remote / Digital
 



 • Start Date: Flexible
 



 Ready to Shape the Future of Consumer Tech?
 



 Send your CV, portfolio (if available), and a short motivation on why you want to join
 



 our team to team@arfve.com.
 



 🚀 Be part of a team designing the next generation of AI-powered consumer
 



 technology.

title: Content Designer - Unannounced Game
description:
We seek storytellers and worldbuilders passionate about their craft and how to utilize dynamic game systems & mechanics best to create exciting experiences for our players. You must find motivation in having the freedom and responsibility to take ownership of tasks and deliver on agreed expectations. You care about quality, and you’re energized by the idea of our many fans around the world praising your work after release. You thrive in a prestigeless, open, and creative environment where people around you love their jobs and the games we make, and where your participation is encouraged in discussions ranging from technical design to art direction and game design. Bring your ideas to our highly experienced team, and together we’ll craft an exciting unannounced game that will leave a lasting impact on our fans.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Content Designer, you will design and implement gameplay experiences within existing gameplay systems. You will also design narratives and write events in American English that thematically fit within the game. In your day-to-day work, you will implement your design using our in-house scripting language, take ownership of deliveries, and work with other Content Designers and other disciplines.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
* Fluent in English with an excellent command of written American English
* A general interest in Strategy games
* A pronounced and varied interest in fiction (in particular science fiction, alt-history, fantasy, steampunk, post-apocalyptic, and others)
* Experience with or interest in code-based scripting


**Desirable Qualifications**
* Professional experience in narrative design, game design or experience performing similar tasks in the modding community
* A strong passion for and experience with Paradox Development Studio Grand Strategy Games such as Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Crusader Kings, or one of our other franchises


 Work Culture
   

  

 You will be part of an experienced team that thrives on collaboration, shared ownership, and a passion for excellence. We value proactive problem-solving and encourage you to speak up, challenge ideas, and drive improvements. Curiosity and a willingness to dive into new challenges are essential in our fast-paced environment. By bringing your energy and creativity, you'll grow as a developer and inspire those around you.
   

  

**Practical information**
 We would like your application to include any relevant work samples and/or a link to your portfolio if you have one. We are especially interested in writing samples and any other content you have produced for games, other media, or even tabletop role-playing games. Don't hesitate to mention how many hours you've spent in any of our games in your application either, as it can become an advantage in your candidacy.
   

  

 Scope: Full-time position
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Reports to: Design Manager
   

  

**We do not offer relocation for this position.**
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $100M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We’re hiring a Senior Product Designer to shape the core experience of the most intuitive legal platform in the world. You’ll work end-to-end—exploring ideas, crafting clear interfaces, and refining details in close collaboration with engineers. The role is execution-first: your strength lies in turning complex workflows into simple, powerful interfaces, especially as we design new patterns for working with AI.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Design user flows, interactions, and interfaces for AI-powered tools
* Turn ambiguous problems into concrete, high-quality product experiences
* Work hands-on with engineers to bring your designs to life
* Use Figma to design, document, and iterate with speed
* Contribute to—and help scale—our design system
* Push for clarity, consistency, and quality in every corner of the product


 Who you are
   

  

* Strong experience designing digital products end-to-end
* A portfolio that shows clear thinking, elegant UI, and shipped product work
* Sharp visual skills and attention to detail
* Curiosity about how AI changes user behavior and interfaces
* Pragmatism and a bias toward shipping over theorizing


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
*Please note - this is an in-house role in our Stockholm office. Remote candidates will not be considered. Unfortunately we cannot help with relocation from other countries or VISA applications. You need a Swedish work permit in order to be considered.*
*Please note - you need a portfolio of relevant art in order to qualify for this role.*
 Hacksaw Studios is a company that builds online games. Our games can be played both in social gaming and real money modes. We have wide distribution and our games are played by millions of people every month by players all over the world. We have a world-class team of developers, artists and animators who create some of the top performing games in our industry, and we are looking to grow our team with more talented graphic designers who love games as much as we do.
   

  

 You will be part of our game development team and work in a tight knit team involving both graphic designers, artists, developers and project managers. We offer a nice office in central Stockholm, an opportunity to work with other experienced game designers as well as a co-ownership program for suitable candidates.
   

  

**The Job**
 We are looking for a graphic designer who can give a fresh take to our games look and brand identity (instant win games) At Hacksaw Studios you will work closely with other designers and creative people to create modern and stylish new games.
   

  

**Your Tasks Will Include**
* Create concepts for new games
* Designing assets, logos and brand guidelines to set new standards
* Participate in game progress reviews and give feedback about the implementation process
* Co-operate with colleagues with similar roles, both in-house and with our partners
* Learn about the online gaming industry and stay up to date on current trends and what is popular with players


**Required Skills And Experience**
* A solid graphic design portfolio
* Understanding of colors, typography, shapes, textures, values and UI/UX
* Experience with the Adobe suite


 To apply for this role, please submit your CV and your portfolio at https://hacksawstudios.bamboohr.com/jobs

title: Level Designer - Mobile Puzzle Games (RELOCATION TO SAUDI ARABIA)
description:
Join a fast-growing game studio creating top-quality mobile puzzle titles for global audiences. Lead the design and development of engaging, balanced levels that keep players coming back.
 







 What you’ll do:
 


* Own level creation from concept to live operation
* Design fun and challenging levels aligned with player retention and monetization goals
* Use player data and A/B testing to refine and improve levels
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and mentor junior designers
* Maintain efficient level design tools and workflows







 What you need:
 


* Proven experience designing mobile puzzle game levels (match-3, tile-blast, or similar)
* Strong understanding of player psychology, pacing, and engagement
* Experience with full production cycles and live game iteration
* Data-driven mindset with KPI and monetization knowledge
* Proficiency in Unity and Excel
* Passion for games and ability to thrive in a dynamic environment







 Ready to shape addictive mobile experiences? Apply now!

title: Experienced E-commerce Designer
description:
As an Experienced E-commerce Designer at Grebban, you will be highly hands-on in producing, designing, and elevating flagship commerce experiences where brand storytelling, creativity, and conversion come together. With your experience, you will not only deliver outstanding design craft but also contribute with knowledge, methods, and best practices that raise the overall quality. In addition, you’ll act as a trusted e-commerce consultant for clients, providing strategic guidance and innovation that help generate customer value and business impact.
 



  





**What you'll be doing** 



* Producing and delivering high-quality e-commerce experiences that balance brand, usability, and conversion
* Acting as an e-commerce consultant for clients, guiding them on strategy, best practices, and innovation to deliver customer value and business impact
* Remaining deeply hands-on in design and production while contributing with insights and best practices from your experience
* Collaborating with clients, designers, developers, and strategists to deliver cohesive solutions
* Fostering a culture of learning and experimentation by sharing knowledge in day-to-day work
* Exploring AI, emerging technologies, and design tools to push boundaries
* Staying ahead of trends in UX/UI, brand, and digital commerce innovation



  





**What you bring** 



* Strong professional experience and a portfolio of impactful e-commerce projects
* Deep understanding of how a brand translates into digital experiences
* Hands-on design, craft and ability to deliver consistent quality work
* Experience introducing design processes or methodologies
* Proficiency in Figma, AI-assisted workflows, and headless CMS/e-commerce platforms
* Great communication skills in both Swedish and English
* A collaborative, communicative, and inspiring approach



  





**Why join Grebban?** 



* Work with leading brands across Europe and beyond on exciting, high-impact projects that drive customer value and business growth
* A highly creative, fast-paced, and collaborative team that values innovation and excellence
* Opportunities for career growth within e-commerce expertise in a rapidly evolving industry
* A culture of knowledge-sharing, where your ideas and insights are valued and encouraged
* Possibility to travel for workshops, client meetings, and industry events across Europe
* Competitive benefits, including pension plans, wellness allowances, and remote work flexibility
* A work environment fueled by curiosity, ambition, and passion for design & commerce



  





**Ready to join?** 




 Send us your application with your CV and portfolio showcasing your best e-commerce/digital design projects.

title: Nordics Lead
description:
**Job Description**
 At Canva, we create tools that empower the world to design. Our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone, on every platform! Inspired by a team of talented thinkers, an amazing culture, and a remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world, one design at a time.
   

  

 Since Canva’s launch in August 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing 220 million active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 15 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we are capable of!
   

  

**About The Team**
 Canva’s International Team is a diverse & distributed team of content specialists, marketers and growth teams who drive user growth, brand awareness, and affinity in our key international markets. You’ll partner closely with leads across the International Supergroup to build and implement a comprehensive multi-year strategy for user and revenue growth goals for your market. You will work with local, regional and central teams including Marketing, Growth, Product, Partnerships, Content, SEO, Education, Community, Sales, NFP, PR, Finance & Strategy.
   

  

 What you’ll work on...
   

  

* Strategy. Act as the main POC and be responsible for overall user and revenue growth in your country. You'll bring together local and global teams across marketing, sales, product, content and finance to create and execute a cohesive multi-year growth strategy, and own the KPIs including MAUs and ARR.
* Localisation. Work closely with the regional team to optimise our product, content, pricing and packaging to meet the needs of local users, informed by a deep understanding of local market dynamics and cultural nuances across a range of audiences, including knowledge workers, SMBs, students, startup ecosystems, NGOs, and other emerging sectors.
* Leadership. Inspire, drive and in some cases coach the in-market team, ensuring a high quality bar for impact and working closely with local speciality leads on performance management.
* Budget. Partner closely with the regional team and marketing lead to shape the marketing strategy and deployment of budget.
* Public face. Represent Canva as a local figurehead across press, PR, events and community, as required.
* Sponsorship. Build and support high value relationships by acting as a local sponsor for enterprise sales, education, government, partnerships, etc.


 You’re probably a match if you are...
   

  

* Fluent in Swedish and English (written and spoken)
* Strongly entrepreneurial, with founder-style appetite for growing something big from a small start and working across everything from education to press.
* Experienced building a market, for example as the regional GM or brand lead for a global SaaS company, or as a proven founder or growth lead in a startup.
* Keenly analytical. Deeply focused on KPIs and obsessive about driving actionable insights from disparate datasets.
* Product oriented, with passion for improving the experience of users and the ability to translate these insights into product requirements.
* Publicity savvy, with experience doing public speaking and acting as a public face to the press and other stakeholders.
* Well networked, ideally with routes into some combination of government departments, corporates, influencers, journalists and local talent.
* A proven leader, able to grow, inspire, and coach high-performing teams. You have high emotional intelligence and empathy, and are a deeply collaborative teammate.
* A strong communicator, fully proficient in spoken and written English, and with the interpersonal skills to influence global and local stakeholders.
* Values aligned. Genuinely excited by Canva’s mission and deeply aligned with our values, and with exceptional references to prove it.


**Additional Information**
 We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.
   

  

 Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

title: Senior Product Manager - Website and Acquisition
description:
Intro
   

  

 At Pleo, we’re on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We’re creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.
   

  

 Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation - which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you’ll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our PLG team, focusing on our website and customer acquisition. In this role, you'll be the brain behind our website's strategy and own the execution of product as an acquisition channel. You'll optimise the funnel to drive conversion for our PLG motion as well as effectively qualify high-intent leads for our sales team. If you're excited about owning a high-impact website that serves both PLG and sales-led motions and are passionate about experimentation, data-driven decisions, and the future of Fin-tech, then this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Please note: We are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this role in any of the listed locations you find in the job info.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As a Senior Product Manager, you will:
   

  

* Lead the website strategy and roadmap to serve both our Product-Led Growth (PLG) and Sales-Led motions, optimizing the funnel from first visit to signup
* Define the strategy and own the execution of product as an acquisition channel (e.g., free tools), leveraging product experiences to generate high-quality leads
* Deeply analyse user behaviour using data from analytics platforms and qualitative research to identify friction points and opportunities for improvement
* Design and execute experiments to optimise conversion rates, lead qualification, across the website and acquisition funnel.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and other product teams to ensure a seamless user experience and effective lead handover
* Develop strategies to increase lead education on the website, ensuring customers have a higher intent and a better understanding of Pleo's value proposition upon signup
* Optimise for SEO and technical health, working closely with engineering and marketing to ensure the website is both high-performing and easily discoverable
* Manage complex stakeholder relationships, balancing requests to deliver a cohesive and high-performing website experience


 What you bring
   

  

 You’ll thrive in this role if you have:
   

  

* Exceptional stakeholder management skills and the ability to navigate complex situations with multiple, often competing, priorities
* Extensive experience with experimentation frameworks (A/B testing) and a data-driven mindset for validating hypotheses
* A strong analytical acumen and proficiency in data analysis tools like Google Analytics, Amplitude, and SQL
* Proven product management experience in a Website team that has served both PLG and Sales-Led motions. PLG motion experience is a hard requirement, while sales-led motions is a plus!
* Deep customer empathy and proven experience conducting user research to translate insights into tangible product improvements
* Strong business acumen with an understanding of SaaS business models, unit economics, and how a website drives revenue
* A passion for solving problems in a creative and innovative way


 Who you’ll be working with and reporting to
   

  

 You’ll report to our PLG Director and work closely with teams within PLG, our GTM functions like Marketing, Rev Ops, Sales, as well as closely with other Product teams. Our team of 8 is highly collaborative and dedicated to Growth.
   

  

 How you’ll develop in this role
   

  

 In your first 3 months at Pleo, you’ll:
   

  

* Lead the Website strategy definition to drive impact in our company acquisition efforts
* Collaborate with Product Marketing to improve the positioning of product as a way to increase lead education launching rapid, hypothesis-driven experiments
* Grow your skills, taking on new challenges as the company continues to scale


 We’re committed to helping you develop your career, whether that means taking on bigger projects, stepping into leadership, or acquiring new skills in Product Led Growth.
   

  

 Show me the benefits!
   

  

* Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
* Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office 🍜
* Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or Médis
* We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
* For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
* Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
* We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
* Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
* Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


**Why join us?**
 Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.
   

  

 We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.
   

  

 Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible
 *and* 
 make sure you still have time to connect with your team.
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
* When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

title: SENIOR PRODUCT OWNER APP
description:
**Senior Product Owner App**
 We’re looking for a dedicated Product Owner for App to optimize performance and user experience, driving our mobile platform to its full potential and supporting our digital sales targets. If you're passionate about conversion optimization, personalization, and mobile innovation this role might be the perfect fit for you
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
* Define, prioritize, and manage the initiatives and optimization backlog for app
* Work with internal stakeholders (ancillaries, UX, analytics, content, loyalty, other) and IT to deliver improvements and new functionalities
* Ensure app platform is conversion-optimized, fast, accessible, and scalable
* In collaboration with the Sr. Product Owner for web, own and manage the relationship with our digital experimentation partner (external), driving the A/B testing roadmap and prioritizing experiments. Use test insights to inform and implement high-impact features and UX improvements.
* Incorporate AI features with focus in personalization, into product roadmap
* Ensure seamless and omnichannel experience by working closely with Sr. Product Owner for Web
* Collaborate with the Digital Campaign & Content Managers to ensure that the website is functional and ready during key campaign periods.
* Lead mobile-specific innovations, including push messaging, offline capabilities, and personalization
* KPIs monitoring and analysis


**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* 8+ years of experience in product ownership or digital product management, with a strong focus on digital platforms
* Proven track record of driving conversion optimization, user experience improvements, and commercial outcomes in eCommerce environments
* Experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., UX/UI, developers, data analysts, marketing) in agile/Lean settings
* Hands-on experience with A/B testing and experimentation frameworks, using data to inform product decisions
* Strong understanding of customer journeys, digital sales funnels, and performance metrics (e.g., CVR, AOV, traffic sources)
* Strong in collaborating with external vendors or tech partners to deliver product improvements
* Experienced in agile ways of working and iterative delivery
* Solid knowledge of Lean and Agile project management methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban)
* Proficient in tools such as JIRA, Miro, or similar platforms for project and product management
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal
* Experience working in or with airlines, travel, or other high-transaction-volume industries is a strong plus


 As a person you bring a positive, high-energy attitude with strong teamwork and well-developed soft skills. Takes full ownership of tasks and projects, showing determination and persistence — not accepting “no” as an answer when driving results. Thinks outside the box, consistently seeking creative solutions and workarounds to overcome challenges and deliver on both team and SAS goals.
   

  

**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Other Of Importance**
* Deadline for application: 28/08/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: As soon as possible.
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need an EU-work permit. Please note that we ask you to inform us if you currently have a valid EU-work permit.
