title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
**Are you a skilled backend software developer ready to grow into a leadership role while staying hands-on in technology?** 
 Join us as a Tech Lead Manager, where you'll lead an empowered development team delivering scalable components for data optimization, billing, account management, and product configuration tooling.
   

  

 This role offers a perfect blend of leadership and technical contributions, giving you the opportunity to guide a team of developers while actively shaping the technical direction.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define clear goals, coach your team members, and foster a collaborative, growth-oriented environment.
* Work closely with your product partner to plan and build the right solutions at the right time.
* Stay hands-on by contributing to backend development, driving DevOps practices, and supporting code reviews, testing, and quality assurance.
* Manage salaries, performance, and career development for your team members.
* Ensure high-quality, timely delivery of technical solutions that meet business needs.
* Balance people leadership with strong technical contributions, making yourself a go-to resource for the team.


**Requirements**
* Strong experience in backend development such as .NET or Java technologies.
* Hands-on knowledge of DevOps practices, including CI/CD and infrastructure as code, and Kubernetes.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
* Experience with code reviews, testing, and ensuring software quality.
* Proven leadership experience or a strong desire to grow into a management role.
* Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to align stakeholders.
* A collaborative, goal-oriented mindset with the ability to inspire and support your team.

title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
That little click on a Radio Receiver (ADS-B) Support Specialist ad? It might just be the start of something big. Either way, you just opened the door to aviation and a global community of users all alongside an excellent crew.
   

  

 Flightradar24 has a rapidly growing network of tens of thousands radio receivers (ADS-B), hosted by volunteers in 200+ countries. The receivers collect positional data transmitted by aircraft and upload it to Flightradar24’s servers. This data is at the heart of the industry-leading flight tracking service we provide to millions of consumers and hundreds of companies.
   

  

 We are looking for a tech-savvy and service-minded individual to join our Support team to help our receiver hosts with both hardware and software related issues. The main goals are maximizing the up-time and coverage from the receivers and keeping the aviation enthusiasts and professionals around the world who upload data to us excited and engaged.
   

  

 The position requires that you are able to work from our office in Stockholm, Sweden. Relocation is not offered for this role.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Help out our community by providing tech support for our ADS-B radio receivers - both hardware and software
* Keep an eye on receivers that come back to us, make repairs where you can, and get them running again
* Spot a bug? Write it up clearly and pass it along to our dev team so they can fix it
* Reach out to our data sharers, offering tips and support to keep their receivers online and covering as much airspace as possible
* Hang out in our online forum, join the conversations, and share your expertise
* Be the voice for better ADS-B hardware and software - always looking for ways we can make our data sharing experience even better


**Who You Are**
* You really like helping people and know how to turn tech support into a “wow” experience for our data sharers
* You’re comfortable with Linux and have hands-on experience with Raspberry Pi devices
* You’re curious about consumer electronics, enjoy troubleshooting, and are always eager to explore new tech
* You have excellent English skills both written and spoken and can communicate clearly and confidently


**Good-to-haves**
* Experience setting up and configuring radio receiver equipment, ideally ADS-B receivers
* Skilled in hand-soldering
* Background in customer support
* Interest in aviation (knowing the difference between an A320 and a 737 is brag-worthy here)
* Proficiency in another major language in addition to English. Preferably Spanish and/or Portuguese
* Experience of keeping forums active and friendly


**About Flightradar24**
 With over 4 million daily users, Flightradar24 is the world’s most popular flight tracking service. Our app regularly tops the App Store and Google Play charts and Wall Street Journal refers to Flightradar24 as the "Facebook of aviation". We also offer a wide range of commercial services and customers include many of the largest names in aviation.
   

  

 We're constantly adding new services and improving existing products. To help us meet those challenges, we're looking for creative, collaborative and tech-savvy applicants to join us.
   

  

 Benefits of working at Flightradar24 include:
   

  

* Opportunity to impact a service with millions of end users from all around the world
* Flexible and social work environment with free beverages, fruit, and snacks
* Modern office in the heart of beautiful downtown Stockholm, Sweden
* Being part of a diverse team with 30+ nationalities and 5 continents represented


 Flightradar24 started as a hobby project in 2006 when two Swedish aviation geeks decided to build a network of ADS-B receivers in Northern and Central Europe. In 2009 we opened up the network, and made it possible for anyone with an ADS-B receiver to upload data to the network. Many parts of the world were quickly covered, but the quest to provide global ADS-B coverage is still ongoing.
   

  

**Flightradar24 at a glance**
* Largest ADS-B network in the world with over 50,000 connected receivers
* 5+ million users per day
* 100+ million app downloads

title: Creative Strategist
description:
Happy Mammoth is a fast-growing natural food tech business selling across the United States, Australia and Europe. We specialize in formulating, producing and marketing gut, digestive and microbiome health foods and natural supplements, designed to help our clients make long-lasting positive health changes and start living very full lives again.
   

  

 Why You'll Love Working at Happy Mammoth
   

  

* Competitive Salary – Your skills and expertise deserve to be rewarded
* Paid Holidays – Relax, recharge, and enjoy well-earned time off
* Work from Anywhere – Your home, a cozy café, or a beachside co-working space—it’s your call!
* Join a Supportive, Global Team – Work with passionate professionals from around the world
* Flexible Working Hours – Manage your schedule in a way that works best for you
* Growth Opportunities – Access free books, courses, and resources to expand your expertise
* Exciting & Dynamic Work Environment – Every day brings new challenges and opportunities
* Make a Real Impact – Help create products that improve people’s lives


 We are looking for a Creative Strategist to join our growing Marketing Team on a full-time basis.
   

  

 Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:
   

  

 📍This is a full-time fully remote contractor role
   

  

 📍We are seeking someone preferably with a background in B2C marketing
   

  

 📍Although the role is remote, the candidate must be available during EU hours (GMT)
   

  

 Your primary role will center on digital media advertising with a keen focus on enhancing our ad campaigns.
   

  

 As a Creative Strategist, you will be responsible for developing innovative and effective strategies that align with our company's objectives and resonate with our target audience. Your role will blend creativity with strategic thinking to drive impactful campaigns and initiatives. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, design, product development, to ensure cohesive messaging and brand consistency across all channels. The ideal candidate will possess a combination of analytical skills, creative flair, and a deep understanding of consumer behavior and market trends.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Strategy Development:
+ Develop comprehensive creative strategies that support business goals and objectives
+ Conduct thorough research and analysis to identify market trends, consumer insights, and competitive landscapes
+ Translate insights into actionable strategies that differentiate our brand and resonate with our target audience


* Campaign Planning and Execution:
+ Collaborate with internal teams to conceptualize and execute integrated marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, social media, print, and events
+ Develop creative briefs and provide clear direction to design and content teams to ensure alignment with strategic objectives
+ Monitor campaign performance and metrics to evaluate effectiveness and identify areas for optimization


* Brand Development and Positioning:
+ Contribute to the development and evolution of our brand identity and messaging
+ Ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints and communication channels
+ Identify opportunities for brand positioning and differentiation in the marketplace


* Cross-Functional Collaboration:
+ Work closely with marketing, design, product development, and sales teams to ensure alignment of messaging and strategy
+ Foster a collaborative environment that encourages creative thinking and innovation
+ Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather input and feedback on creative initiatives


* Trend Analysis and Innovation:
+ Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and cultural shifts
+ Apply insights to inform creative strategies and develop innovative solutions
+ Experiment with new approaches and techniques to continually improve campaign performance and engagement


 Qualifications:
   

  

* Proven experience in a creative strategy role, preferably in an advertising agency or marketing department
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and insights to drive strategic decisions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasively
* Creative mindset with a passion for developing innovative and compelling campaigns
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines effectively
* Proficiency in digital marketing platforms and tools
* Familiarity with design principles and an eye for aesthetics
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to change
* Strong collaborative spirit and ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams


 CVs must be in ENGLISH.
   

  

 Powered by JazzHR
   

  

 CeTDxfkqAr

title: Data Engineer to Credit Risk | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow. As a leading financial services group in northern Europe, we'll help you grow and empower you to take on more responsibility to create a real difference. Welcome to SEB.
   

  

 We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our Credit Risk team and contribute to optimizing data pipelines, enhancing analytical capabilities, and ensuring data integrity across critical credit risk models.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Data Engineer within our Credit Risk team, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining data infrastructure that supports our credit risk modeling efforts. You will work closely with Quantitative modelers, model experts, and other stakeholders to ensure the availability, accuracy, and reliability of data used in our credit risk models.
   

  

**Data Engineer Role Also Involves**
* Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop, and maintain scalable, efficient data pipelines to support credit risk modelling, analysis and reporting.
* Collaboration with Quantitative modelers and product experts: Work closely to ensure the data infrastructure supports the development of predictive credit risk models.
* Data Quality & Governance: Collaboration with Data stewards to ensure high-quality, accurate, and consistent data for credit risk modeling and reporting.
* Data Integration & Management: Integrate data from various internal and external sources into a unified data ecosystem.
* Automation & Optimization: Automate and optimize data processes to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of reporting and risk assessments.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Proven experience in a Data Engineer or in a similar role, preferably within the financial sector.
* Technical Expertise: Proficient in SQL, Python, and data modelling techniques and working with large datasets.
* Data Warehousing: Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and best practices for data integration and storage.
* Data Governance: Strong understanding of data quality, security, and governance best practices.
* Problem Solving: Ability to solve complex problems and attention to detail.
* Communication: Strong communication skills with the ability to collaborate across teams, both technical and non-technical.
* Risk Management Understanding: Familiarity with credit risk, Basel III, and other financial risk frameworks is a plus.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Degree: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
* Experience in Credit Risk: Experience with risk models, including credit scoring, financial regulations, and portfolio analysis, is highly desirable.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to work with complex datasets.
* Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).


**What We Offer**
 We provide a wide range of experiences and benefits to our employees, and while each person’s career journey is unique, the key components that form the foundation of what we offer include:
   

  

* Challenging and meaningful work in an ambitious, highly professional, and truly awesome cross border team.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits, health insurance and other employee benefits.
* Extensive training, many learning opportunities.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30 of September 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Indra Wilson at indra.wilson@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner, Olga Wohlfahrt at olga.wohlfahrt@seb.se
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Sales Operations Analyst
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We're looking for a Sales Operations Analyst to join Sinch on a temporary 1-year contract. This hybrid role is based in Stockholm, Sweden, with an anticipated start date in the second week of January 2026. You'll support our global Operator Sales team in making smart, data-driven decisions, streamlining processes, and improving sales efficiency across our global operations.
   

  

 You'll be part of a supportive team, helping shape how we work by collaborating across departments and enabling better business outcomes through tools, insights, and proactive problem-solving.
   

  

* Manage and improve processes and tools for analyzing revenue, cost, and traffic volume to support optimization efforts.
* Provide actionable insights through advanced analytics and reporting using Excel, Tableau, Salesforce, and SAP ByDesign.
* Monitor customer profitability and partner with Sales and Product teams to recommend pricing strategies.
* Create visual management reports and forecasts on A2P and P2P messaging trends, and support price adjustments and customer notifications.
* Support invoice reviews, ensure accurate sales processes and documentation, and drive tool improvements and cross-functional projects.


**Requirements**
* 2-5 years of experience in sales operations, finance, or similar. Preferably in telecom (excluding hardware), SaaS, or wholesale messaging.
* University degree in Business, Finance, Computer Science, or related field.
* Proficient in Excel (pivots, formulas) and quick to learn new tools.
* Curious about sales metrics and performance insights, with a drive to learn.


**Bonus If You Have**
* Experience with Salesforce or other CRMs, Tableau or similar BI tools.
* Knowledge of A2P/P2P messaging.
* Worked in an international company.


 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in
 **English** 
 .
   

  

****OUR HIRING PROCESS****
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Security Operations Analyst
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, the work we do every day redefines the standards of care and transform the lives of people living with rare diseases.
   

  

 As a diverse team of entrepreneurial people, we are passionate about our growth journey towards becoming a global leader, making a difference for rare disease patients, moving quickly and always challenging the status quo.
   

  

 We are committed to an inclusive, sustainable and flexible workplace that fosters growth and development.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Security Operations Specialist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in cybersecurity and operations, with a passion for protecting and securing our organization's digital assets. Stay up-to-date with the latest cybersecurity trends and technologies to continuously improve the organization's security posture.
   

  

 Collaboration is key in our team, and you enjoy working closely with colleagues across different functions to ensure the highest level of security. At the same time, you are self-driven and capable of making independent decisions when needed. You have a natural curiosity for emerging cyber threats and continuously seek to expand your knowledge in IT security.
   

  

 This position is based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, reporting to the Head of Cyber Security & Network.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Monitor and analyze security events and incidents, using SIEM and security tools, to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities. Work alongside SOC to improve detection.
* Investigate and respond to security incidents, mitigating risks before they escalate.
* Implement and maintain security controls and measures to protect the organization's information systems.
* Collaborate with other teams to develop and enforce security policies and procedures.
* Conduct regular security assessments and audits to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
* Stay up to date with the latest cybersecurity trends and technologies to continuously improve the organization's security posture.
* Lead and help organization with IAM implementation and requirements.
* Provide guidance and improve Access control management.


**Qualifications**
**About you**
 You are a proactive and analytical problem-solver with a strong passion for cybersecurity. In our fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment, you thrive on taking initiative and staying one step ahead of potential threats. You have a sharp eye for detail, a critical-thinking mindset, and the ability to assess complex security challenges with confidence.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* 5+ years of proven experience in IT security operations work.
* Strong knowledge of IT security, networks, and cybersecurity principles.
* Experience with incident response, threat detection, and risk mitigation.
* Problem-solving skills and a critical-thinking mindset to assess and counter cyber threats.
* Ability to communicate complex security issues to technical and non-technical teams.The position requires the ability to express complex ideas fluently and spontaneously, requiring a C1 (advanced) level of Swedish & English.


**Meriting**
* Experience working with Microsoft defender
* Experience working with SASE (SSE)
* Experience working with Azure
* Professional Certifications such as CISSP, ISSAP, or Azure certifications


 Here at Sobi we live by our core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**How to apply**
 We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible. Click apply and include your resume in English.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Competitive compensation for your work
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


 Sobi is a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. We are a specialised international biopharmaceutical company transforming the lives of people with rare and debilitating diseases, providing reliable access to innovative medicines in the areas of haematology, immunology, and specialty care. Sobi’s share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. More about Sobi at sobi.com and LinkedIn.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

title: Supply Chain Manager
description:
Happy Mammoth is a fast-growing natural food tech business selling across Australia, Europe and the United States. We specialize in formulating, producing and marketing gut, digestive and microbiome health foods and natural supplements, designed to help our clients make long-lasting positive health changes and start living very full lives again.
   

  

 What You Get:
   

  

* Competitive salary in USD
* Work remotely from anywhere in the world such as your home, co-working space or cafe
* Lots of variation to keep the day-to-day exciting
* Free access to books, courses and anything else that helps improve your skill set


 We are looking to hire a Supply Chain Manager to help us keep growing. If you're hard-working and dedicated, Happy Mammoth is an ideal place to get ahead. Apply today!
   

  

**Qualifications & Experience**
 ∙ Must have 5 years’ experience in manufacturing industries (pref. in food).
   

  

 ∙ Must have 3 years’ experience in Supply Chain or similar role
   

  

 ∙ Strong industry knowledge
   

  

 ∙ Strong communication and interpersonal skills
   

  

 ∙ Exceptional organisation and negotiation skills
   

  

 Tasks & responsibilities
   

  

 ∙ Integral part of the entire process from R&D to finished product
   

  

 ∙ Responsible for overseeing internal processes and procedures within Supply Chain whilst liaising with Quality Assurance, Finance and Operations Manager
   

  

 ∙ Sourcing, negotiating, procuring ingredients – blanket orders, forecasts, meeting budgets
   

  

 ∙ Managing of accurate inventory levels based on analytical data – working with internal and external partners to maximise profit
   

  

 ∙ Managing, co-ordinating and planning production schedules, lead times, production shifts – minimising OOS.
   

  

 ∙ Managing and co-ordinating logistics – planning and booking freight, liaising with warehouse to ensure deliveries and lead times are met
   

  

 ∙ Maintaining relationships of all third-party suppliers (packaging, ingredients), distributors, and key accounts
   

  

 ∙ Building & Maintaining relationships of all third-party suppliers (packaging, ingredients), distributors, and key accounts
   

  

 ∙ Leading Team of Production Coordinators

title: Social Media Manager
description:
**Happy Mammoth** 
 is a fast-growing natural food tech business selling across the United States, Australia and Europe. We specialize in formulating, producing and marketing gut, digestive and microbiome health foods and natural supplements, designed to help our clients make long-lasting positive health changes and start living very full lives again.
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **Full time** 
**Social Media** 
**Manager** 
 to manage our social media presence on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter for all our brands. You’ll be mainly responsible for producing content for our pages (videos, posts, etc.), managing the channels (uploading content, planning the strategy).
   

  

**Why You'll Love Working at** 
**Happy Mammoth** 
**:**
* Competitive Salary – Your skills and expertise deserve to be rewarded
* Paid Holidays - Take all the time you need to binge-watch your favorite shows, explore new places, or just relax. It’s on us!
* Work from Anywhere – Your home, a cozy café, or a beachside co-working space—it’s your call!
* Join a Supportive, Global Team – Work with passionate professionals from around the world
* Flexible Working Hours – Manage your schedule in a way that works best for you
* Exciting & Dynamic Work Environment – Every day brings new challenges and opportunities
* Make a Real Impact – Help create products that improve people’s lives


**Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:**
* This is a fully remote full-time contractor role
* We are seeking someone preferably with a background in B2C marketing
* Although the role is remote, the candidate must be available during EU hours (GMT)


**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and manage the organic social media strategy aligned with brand tone, content pillars, and marketing goals
* Plan and maintain the content calendar across platforms (e.g., Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, YouTube, Facebook, X)
* Create and produce high-performing posts—static, video, stories, lives, carousels
* Source and integrate UGC, testimonials, and influencer content into the feed
* Monitor comments, DMs, and brand mentions in a timely and brand-consistent manner
* Track channel performance and report on KPIs: engagement rate, reach, growth, saves, shares, and sentiment
* Identify trends, conversations, and opportunities to keep the brand relevant


**Qualifications:**
* Proven experience managing and creating content for social media platforms
* Background working with D2C e-commerce brands
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities
* Strong understanding of audience engagement and content planning
* Experience collaborating with other creators and influencers
* Solid visual and written communication skills
* Self-motivated, deadline-driven, and full of fresh ideas
* Being a content creator is a strong plus (not mandatory)
* Experience in the wellness industry — prior work with supplements is highly appreciated
* Strong ability to manage projects independently and drive them from concept to completion.


**CVs must be in English**
 Powered by JazzHR

title: IT Manager – Business Application Domain
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**
*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*
**IT Manager – Business Applications**
 Location: Stockholm
   

  

**Own the Future of Business Applications at Arrive**
 Are you a seasoned IT leader who thrives on transformation, building trust across the business, and delivering real outcomes through technology?
   

  

 At
 **Arrive** 
 , we’re scaling fast—and we’re looking for an
 **IT Manager** 
 to lead our
 **Business Applications domain** 
 during a critical phase of growth. This is a
 **senior leadership role** 
 , ideal for someone who brings a rare blend of technical depth, operational insight, and human-centered leadership. If you've shaped IT delivery in
 **tech-driven or high-growth organizations** 
 , led application teams across
 **Customer Care, ERP, or Middleware** 
 , and know how to align business needs with IT execution—this could be your next move.
   

  

**What You’ll Lead And Deliver**
 Strategic Leadership & Transformation
   

  

* Own and drive the transformation of our SaaS application landscape to support scalable, efficient operations.
* Define and implement an effective IT delivery model—bridging the gap between business requirements and system execution.
* Build trust with business stakeholders, creating partnerships that encourage shared ownership—not just handover.


**Tech & Application Management**
* Lead a cross-functional team across Customer Care systems, ERP, and middleware applications, balancing operations and development.
* Maintain a dynamic 12-month roadmap focused on high-impact priorities and continuous improvement.
* Guide application lifecycle management, support models, and platform governance.


**Stakeholder & Relationship Building**
* Be the go-to leader who translates business goals into technical roadmaps and delivers them.
* Build meaningful relationships across functions, fostering empathy, collaboration, and a shared sense of purpose.
* Act as the senior escalation point for internal and external partners.


**Performance, Innovation & Growth**
* Define and track KPIs, SLAs, and OKRs aligned with strategic business outcomes.
* Champion innovation and automation within the business applications landscape.
* Lead retrospectives and feedback cycles to continuously evolve how we work and deliver.


**Governance, Risk & Compliance**
* Ensure applications and vendors meet compliance standards across security, data privacy, and audit readiness.
* Oversee vendor performance, contracts, and budget ownership.


**What You Bring**
* Senior IT leadership experience in business transformation, ideally in a tech, SaaS, or high-growth organization.
* Proven background managing Customer Care systems, ERP platforms or middleware - across both operations and development.
* Strong capability in translating complex business needs into actionable technical strategies.
* Deep understanding of enterprise SaaS, integration, and application governance models.
* Natural relationship-builder. Empathetic, curious, and trusted by stakeholders.
* A leader who takes ownership, builds delivery frameworks, and inspires others to do the same.


**Why Join Arrive?**
 At
 **Arrive** 
 , technology is not just a function—it’s a force for connection, scale, and progress. We’re creating the structures that will carry us into the next phase of our journey, and this role sits right at the heart of that mission.
   

  

**You’ll Join**
* A collaborative and ambitious team with the autonomy to shape your domain.
* A company where IT is seen as a strategic enabler, not just a service.
* A fast-paced environment where curiosity, accountability, and innovation are valued.


**About Us**
*Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.*

Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

title: Corporate Development Associate
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 175,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, you will work closely with our corporate strategy and corporate development leaders, as well as with the different stakeholders globally within the business units and regional organizations of the company. We collaborate with several consulting firms, investment banks, and analytics companies to evaluate different opportunities.
   

  

 We believe that you are skilled in preparing impactful perspectives to assess and enhance our strategy, as well as to create and prepare materials for driving important decisions by top management and the board of directors. During transactions you will also lead and support different analysis and workstreams, including conducting diligences and supporting the advancement of potential negotiations.
   

  

 This is an important role within Sinch and there is a significant opportunity to leave a legacy through building processes and systems, truly having a structural impact on how the Strategy and M&A team is built and run moving forward.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead and support strategic framing, strategy projects, and formulating corporate strategy
* Lead and support M&A activities, extending across the transaction lifecycle
* Support top management and the board of directors with important decision support
* Continuously look for opportunities to improve our strategic trajectory and ways of working
* Manage team tools, including transaction pipelines, competitive intelligence, and more


 The role is based at our headquarters in Stockholm and reports to our Head of Strategy and M&A. International travel may be required from time-to-time.
   

  

**About You**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you have experience from strategy and transaction activities, preferably from Financial Services or from a Consulting Firm. You have excellent people and communication skills and an ability to gain rapport with stakeholders. You are also a driven self-starter with the ability to work under your own initiative as well as part of a team.
   

  

* About 2-5 years of experience from a similar role from an investment bank, management consulting firm, or related industry
* Strong business acumen and understanding of financial statements
* Strong interest in Software and Tech industry
* Degree in business, economics, or engineering or related field
* Fluency in English is a requirement, other languages are a plus


**About The Recruitment Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Chief Product Officer
job_function: Strategy/Planning, Product Management, and Information Technology
description:
We are looking for a commercial and customer-centric
 **Chief Product Officer** 
 to join
 *Timextender* 
 and drive innovation and scalable growth.
 



  





*Does this sound like you? Then read on!* 




  





 Time is our only finite resource, which is why we constantly strive to simplify, automate, and execute on what matters most. TimeXtender automates data integration workflows using metadata and advanced AI. Our low-code solution allows you to rapidly ingest, prepare, and deliver business-ready data, all while reducing operational costs and ensuring your infrastructure is secure and future-proof.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As the CPO, you will design and lead the product organisation by setting the overall product direction and priorities, overseeing operations and driving strategic initiatives. This is a pivotal leadership role at the heart of our growth strategy, where you'll shape and deliver our roadmap with a clear commercial focus. You'll work closely with customers, partners, and cross our internal functions, ensuring our offerings remain genuinely impactful and competitive.
 



  





 You will implement modern product practices and processes to ensure we deliver real-world value to our users, while advancing our mission to empower the world with data, mind and heart.
 



  





*This role is remote and you must be located and authorised to work in Stockholm, Sweden.* 




  





 This is a high-velocity, high-impact role that requires you to learn fast, adapt quickly and deliver at pace. You’ll need to absorb technical information, think strategically, and bring a ‘get-it-done’ mindset to overcome challenges.
 



  





**Your work will directly shape the future experience for our customers and in this role we see you:** 



* Develop and execute a product vision that delivers value for customers and fuels our commercial ambitions.
* Lead the end-to-end product lifecycle, balancing long-term vision with rapid, high-quality execution.
* Build and empower a high-performance product team, instilling a culture of innovation, agility and excellence in delivery.
* Act as a market advocate: collaborate closely with customers, partners and commercial leaders (CRO, CMO) to ensure product-market fit and customer success.
* Champion modern product management practices, leveraging AI, automation, and data-driven experimentation.
* Optimise product development processes for scalability, efficiency and impact.
* Continuously collaborate and spar with our CTO and technology organization.



  





**We want a leader with:** 



* Proven leadership experience related to product management and ownership in high-growth, tech-intensive businesses.
* Deep experience in data management, analytics or SaaS platforms - or similarly complex, B2B domains.
* Strategic vision balanced with executional excellence. Ability to define a long-term product vision while delivering on immediate business priorities.
* Demonstrated ability to drive commercial outcomes through product innovation.
* Familiarity with modern technologies, including AI, automation and scalable system design.
* Track record in building and scaling diverse product teams.
* Thorough experience in, and understanding of, modern product management methodologies that enable innovation.
* Superior communication skills, translating vision into actionable product plans for technical and non-technical audiences alike.
* Obsession for understanding customer needs and turning insights into breakthrough solutions.
* Strong technical abilities with a proven ability to work on complex and technical products.
* The ability to think strategically while driving execution with attention to detail in a very fast-paced environment.
* Skilled in leveraging data and analytics to inform product direction and priorities.
* Experience in a product leadership role, owning the entire product lifecycle and scaling complex products



  





**We offer:** 



* A competitive compensation which includes annual base salary plus eligibility for performance-based bonus. Final offer will be based on experience, skills, and location. Additional benefits include health insurance, retirement plan, paid time off, and other company programs as applicable.
* An opportunity to join an ambitious, global, hyper-growth company that seeks to make a real impact on the world with our core purpose to
 ***"Empower the world with data, mind and heart. Because time matters."***
* Working as a part of a fully distributed organisation with satellite offices around the world.
* We also have regular in-person meetups because we love spending time together.
* Laptop, monitor, etc. and reimbursement of phone and internet cost.
* Home office setup allowance.



  





 Ready to help shape the future of data integration and analytics? Apply now and become part of TimeXtender’s growth journey!
 



  





**About TimeXtender** 




 At TimeXtender, everything we do is 100% driven by our core purpose
 ***“Empower the world with data, mind, and heart”.***
 We believe in
 **simplifying** 
 ,
 **automating** 
 and
 **executing** 
 . And because time matters, we engage fully charged. Read more about who we are and how we work from
 
 here
 
 .
 



**We can't wait to hear from you!** 




*For further related questions, contact us at xgt@timextender.com*

title: Quantitative Risk Analyst to Credit Risk Team | SEB, Stockholm
description:
SEB is a leading financial services group and one of the largest employers in the Nordics and Baltics. As the banking industry evolves rapidly, we take pride in our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in navigating these changes. Does this sound like the right fit for you?
   

  

 We are looking for a Quantitative Credit Risk Analyst to join our Credit Risk team. You will be responsible for development and review of quantitative models that assess credit risk. The role will require to use mathematical, statistical, and machine learning techniques to analyze large datasets, including historical loan performance, customer data, and macroeconomic indicators, to extract trends and construct risk factors.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Quantitative Risk Analyst you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Development and review of credit risk models aligned with banking regulations and business needs.
* Perform modelling using ready made-tools, focus on modelling rather than coding.
* Collaborating with business areas to provide insights in to data and explain model outputs.
* Monitoring and back-testing credit risk models to ensure accuracy and regulatory compliance.
* Contributing to various projects related with data quality, regulatory and etc. within credit risk.
* Collaborate with Data Engineers and Python Developers to ensure the data infrastructure and modeling tools effectively support the development of predictive credit risk models.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
* Strong background in mathematics, statistics, econometrics, finance, or related quantitative fields.
* Experienced with programming languages such as Python, SAS.
* Ability to work with large datasets and use statistical software and data visualization tools.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.


 Though not explicitly required for a successful candidate, the following would be considered an advantage:
   

  

* Experience in model development and/or review within credit risk contexts.
* Familiarity with credit risk frameworks, including PD/LGD/CCF modelling and IRB approaches.
* Educational background in statistics, mathematics or econometrics.


**What We Offer**
 We provide a wide range of experiences and benefits to our employees, and while each person’s career journey is unique, the key components that form the foundation of what we offer include:
   

  

* Challenging and meaningful work in an ambitious, highly professional, and truly awesome cross border team.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits, health insurance and other employee benefits.
* Extensive training, many learning opportunities.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30 of September 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Indra Wilson at indra.wilson@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner, Olga Wohlfahrt at olga.wohlfahrt@seb.se
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Senior IT Analyst
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **5+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

 Rollbeskrivning:
   

  

**We are looking for a Senior IT Analyst for our client in the financial industry**
**Job Description:**
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and document business strategies(in alignment with the target picture to enable sustainable solutions).
* Eliciting functional and non-functional requirements by co operating with different stakeholders e.g. architects, developers, testers, business, legal.
* Translate business strategies into detailed technical requirements for the IT team.
* Securing requirements traceability during smooth end-to-end development.
* Being responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement.
* Supporting testers and developers in the team and hub.
* Verify developed solutions by conducting test results.
* Provide insights to stakeholders on the effectiveness of implemented solutions.


**Required skills:**
* Experience in IT and/or business analysis
* Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration
* Experience of using Jira, Confluence.
* Experience or knowledge of API development, Data Mapping and Process Modelling
* Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain.
* Practical knowledge of SQL, user interface prototyping and design
* Knowledge of Architecture diagrams like sequence diagrams.
* Solid technical knowledge for effective collaboration with developers.
* Proficiency with analysis tools and methodologies.


**Nice-to-have Knowledge And Experience**
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements in the banking sector.
* Practical knowledge of REST/SOAP API.
* Knowledge of PSD2,PSD3/PSR.


**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Spontanansökan
description:
**Kort om oss**
 Linklaters LLP lämnar juridisk rådgivning till världens ledande företag, sponsorer och finansiella institutioner i de mest komplexa transaktionerna och ärendena. Med 31 kontor i de främsta affärs- och finanscentra, levererar Linklaters en unik service till klienter över hela världen. Läs mer om oss på www.linklaters.com eller lyssna på vår podd här.
   

  

**Vem kan söka?**
 Detta är en annons skapad för dig som antingen är:
   

  

* intresserad av ett extrajobb vid sidan av dina studier, eller
* nyligen eller inom kort avslutar dina juridikstudier eller tingsnotariat och är intresserad av en heltidstjänst som biträdande jurist.


 I de fall där vi inte har en specifik annons ute kan du använda denna annons för att visa ditt intresse för en eventuell anställning hos oss.
   

  

*Eftersom denna annons avser spontanansökningar kommer vi endast att återkoppla till de sökande om ett behov uppstår, och då till dem vars profil stämmer överens med våra krav.*
 Vid frågor, vänligen kontakta Marie Lundqvist, HR Advisor.
   

  

**Technical Skills**
**This list of duties and responsibilities above is not exhaustive. It is intended to describe the general content of, and requirements for, the performance of this job. As such, the role may also include the undertaking of additional tasks as required.**

title: Talented Analyst to join our expert Retail Credit Risk modelling team | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Do you believe that good quality data is the key to most of the things we do?
   

  

 The Credit Risk team is part of Group Risk and the wider CRO organization in SEB. Credit Risk covers IRB, IFRS9 and stress testing models across all jurisdictions and legal entities of SEB Group. As an analyst in the Retail Credit Risk team you will be covering data, monitoring, reporting and modelling issues for the retail segment that consists of small corporate and private individual lending exposures.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The position covers various dimensions of credit risk quantitative analysis including:
   

  

* Structured data management and analysis, working with large datasets.
* Supporting the team as well as business, credit analysis and other teams, with data driven insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
* Upholding and improving data quality control framework, representing credit risk quantification in group functions involved in data quality.
* Identifying data deficiencies and contributing to designing solutions to address such deficiencies (from input to IT development requirements to design of regular controls for ensuring adequate data quality).
* Interaction with control functions and IT development, specification of IT development requirements.
* Documentation and regulatory interaction.
* Responsibilities and tasks within the role of a data steward.


 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

* You are a team player with an analytical and strategic mindset with the ability to transform theory into concrete action.
* High integrity and ethical standards.
* True interest in what data can tell you, and drive for continuous improvement of data quality, including improving data frameworks to support that drive.
* Excellent analyst skills, hands-on experience with extraction and visualization of insights from large datasets and long timeseries.
* Proven communication and presentation skills, excellent ability to present complex and technical matters to both non-specialists and specialists is essential.
* Good Python and SQL skills, knowledge of SAS is an advantage.
* Visual Analytics tools experience is an advantage.
* Knowledge of IRB models and regulatory frameworks is an advantage.
* Excellent written and spoken English is critical, good knowledge of Swedish will be an advantage.


 What we offer
   

  

* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* Challenging and interesting projects at the forefront of credit risk modelling.
* Attractive compensation and benefits.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30 of September 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Indra Wilson at indra.wilson@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner, Olga Wohlfahrt at olga.wohlfahrt@seb.se
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career

title: Försvarsmakten söker IT-säkerhetshandläggare
description:
Vill du vara med och stärka Sveriges försvarförmåga inom området IT-säkerhet? Vi står inför en spännande och intensiv utvecklingsfas där vi nu söker IT-säkerhetshandläggare för att stärka upp vårt team. Vår arbetsplats präglas av mycket god kamratanda och hög tekniska kompetens.
   

  

 Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som IT-säkerhetshandläggare kan du se fram emot varierande arbetsuppgifter som bland annat innefattar att samorda och utveckla arbetet inom IT- och informationssäkerhet genom deltagande i projekt/uppdrag och som stöd till kollegor i linjeverksamheten.
   

  

 I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår också att deltaga i Försvarsmaktens ackrediteringsprocess för IT-system där din roll som IT-säkerhetshandläggare ska stödja med att granska krav samt granska/skapa dokumentation gällande IT-säkerhet.
   

  

 Du kommer även att ingå i arbetet med framtagning av riktlinjer och policys rörande IT-säkerhet, vara sakkunnig avseende IT-säkerhet där utbildning av egen organisation ingår.
   

  

 Vad vi erbjuder dig
   

  

 Verksamheten erbjuder stor variation och komplexitet samt stora krav på IT-säkerhet vilket innebär goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och förutsättningar för intern karriär rörlighet. Våra anställda har ett flertal olika förmåner, bland annat:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling utifrån ett verksamhetsbehov och dina karriärsmål
* Tre timmar träning i veckan på arbetstid och du kan få ersättning för träningskläder och startavgifter
* Bra balans mellan arbete och fritid med flexibel arbetstid samt 28-35 semesterdagar beroende på din ålder
* Lönetillägg vid föräldraledighet och VAB samt möjlighet att växla semesterdagar mot extra pensionsavsättning


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

* Universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom IT, alternativt att du har motsvarande förvärvad erfarenhet/utbildning som Försvarsmakten bedömer som likvärdig
* Minst 2 års aktuell relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT-säkerhetsområdet
* Erfarenhet av att tolka regelverk och omsättning av regler till krav på IT-system och verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsstandarder och regelverk som GDPR, NIS2, ISO 27001 eller liknande
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka sig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* Svensk medborgare
* Körkort lägst klass B


 Meriterande
   

  

* Utbildningar och certifieringar inom IT-säkerhet (ex CISM)
* Erfarenhet av arbete med ackreditering av IT-system
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsarbete inom Försvarsmakten eller annan statlig myndighet


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

 Du är målmedveten och drivs av att skapa förutsättningar för veksamhet att nå sina uppställda mål. Du är engagerad, självgående, har förmågan att ta egna initiativ samt har god analytisk förmåga. Du har sinne för struktur, god planering samt förmågan att se ett helhetsperspektiv. Samarbetsförmåga är en stark sida hos dig.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 Befattningen är tillsvidare och inleds med 6 månaders provanställning för dig som inte är anställd inom Försvarsmakten. Placeringsort är Stockholm, tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Din ansökan skall innehålla CV samt ett personligt brev.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-09-01. För eventuella frågor om rekryteringsprocessen maila HR, stina.bengtsson@mil.se.
   

  

**Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Information om Försvarsmakten och det rekryterande förbandet: Försvarsmaktens telekommunikations- och informationssystemförband, FMTIS, säkerställer Försvarsmaktens förmåga att kommunicera och leda - dygnet runt, året om. Förbandet har ett samlat ansvar för Försvarsmaktens tekniska ledningssystem som stödjer militära insatser till sjöss, på land och i luften – i Sverige och utomlands. Förbandet har över 1 800 medarbetare på mer än 30 orter runt om i landet. Läs mer på https://jobb.forsvarsmakten.se/fmtis En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras samt att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Role: Business Development Manager** 




**Experience (Years): 15+ Years** 




  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Key Accountabilities:** 




  




* Seek out target stakeholders in customer organisations and build relationships
* Generate leads by proactively reaching out to prospective customers (both cold customers and active customers). Build and convert a pipeline of qualified leads.
* Manage entire sales process end to end for the designated customers. This includes deal identification and leading the customer and TCS team through the deal life-cycle. Create compelling business solutions, manage customer interactions and win bids.
* Develop an account plan and sales strategy for the identified key account that ensures attainment of the company’s revenue targets.
* Book new revenues from the acquired companies.
* As a sales lead and a team player - manage the bid team made of diverse set of individuals towards winning the sales opportunity.



  





**Key Qualities / Skills Required:** 




  




* Networked Sales Executive, with C-level connects in Manufacturing and Retail sectors.
* Track Record of closing high value deals in Manufacturing and Retail sectors in Sweden.
* Hands-on experience and full understanding of Manufacturing and Retail value chains and business patterns.
* Direct experience in IT outsourcing, Business process outsourcing.
* CXO level personal stature and gravitas, capable of engaging with CXOs in a purposeful and credible manner to present strategic sourcing solutions.
* Solutioning skills: ability to create client specific solutions leveraging TCS’ offerings.
* Enthusiasm to work in a global multi-cultural firm environment.
* Team Player who thrives in a team environment and enjoys shared success.



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **ajay.androw@tcs.com**

title: Quantitative Python Developer to Credit Risk Team | SEB, Stockholm
description:
SEB is a leading financial services group and one of the largest employers in the Nordics and Baltics. As the banking industry evolves rapidly, we take pride in our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in navigating these changes. Does this sound like the right fit for you?
   

  

 We are looking for a skilled Quantitative Python Developer to join our Credit Risk team. You will work at the intersection of quantitative modelling, software engineering, and risk management, helping to build and maintain tools that assess, monitor, and forecast credit risk.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role you can expect to:
   

  

* Develop and maintain Python-based tools and libraries for credit risk modelling and analytics,
* Collaborate with quantitative risk analysts and model validators to ensure model accuracy and regulatory compliance,
* Design and support frameworks for capital calculation, e.g., Basel IV.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
* An academic degree in computer science, engineering or a related technical field,
* Knowledge in mathematics, statistics or econometrics,
* Strong Python programming skills, with experience in scientific computing libraries such as NumPy, pandas, SciPy, and scikit-learn.
* Experience with statistical modeling, time series analysis, or machine learning,
* Experience with SQL and working with large datasets,
* Ability to translate mathematical formulas and algorithms into functional code,
* Proficiency with Git and GitHub for version control and collaborative development,
* Strong communication skills and ability to work in cross-functional teams.


 Though not explicitly required for a successful candidate, the following would be considered an advantage:
   

  

* Experience developing and maintaining python libraries,
* Knowledge of regulatory requirements (e.g., Basel III/IV, IFRS 9, CCAR),
* Previous open source contributions or active participation in developer communities,
* Familiarity with GitHub Actions or other CI/CD tools.


**What We Offer**
 We provide a wide range of experiences and benefits to our employees, and while each person’s career journey is unique, the key components that form the foundation of what we offer include:
   

  

* Challenging and meaningful work in an ambitious, highly professional, and truly awesome cross border team.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits, health insurance and other employee benefits.
* Extensive training, many learning opportunities.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30 of September 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Indra Wilson at indra.wilson@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner, Olga Wohlfahrt at olga.wohlfahrt@seb.se
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer
