title: Talent Sourcer - Deltid
description:
Brinner du för att skapa relationer, är duktig på att kommunicera och förstår värdet av en bra kandidatupplevelse?
   

  

 Vi letar efter en Talent Sourcer med stort intresse för människor och som är en fena på att hitta och skapa kontakt med attraktiva kandidater. Här finns en möjlighet för dig som studerar att utvecklas inom rekrytering och bli en nyckelperson i vårt härliga TA team.
   

  

**Om** 
**rollen**
 Som Talent Sourcer får du en mycket viktig roll i vårt arbete med att kartlägga och identifiera framtida kollegor inom främst IT & Tech samt stötta våra chefer och Talent Acquisition Partners med att rekrytera rätt kompetens.
   

  

 I rollen arbetar du i rekryteringsprocessens första steg, där du deltar i uppstartsmöte med rekryterande chef för att få en gedigen bild av tjänsten, teamet och kravprofilen. Därefter blir din uppgift att genomföra kartläggning och search i externa kanaler (främst på LinkedIn), arbeta med tidigt urval samt ansvara för den första kontakten med potentiella framtida kollegor.
   

  

 Tillsammans med ansvarig Talent Acquisition Partner är du delaktig i:
   

  

* Att identifiera och kartlägga relevanta kandidater samt genomföra första telefonintervju
* Uppstartsmöten, skapande av kravprofil och kartläggning inför search
* Arbeta proaktivt med att bygga ett nätverk av kandidater med fokus på IT & Tech
* Delta i bedömningar, kandidatpresentationer och digitala referenstagningar
* Ge feedback och återkoppling till kandidater


 Vi är ett härligt Talent Acquisition team med ett stort driv och intresse för att ge den bästa kandidatupplevelsen och servicen till både våra kandidater och rekryterande chefer. Vi har roligt på jobbet samtidigt som vi levererar högsta kvalitet. Vårt team stödjer olika delar i verksamheten vilket ställer stora krav på oss att arbeta båda självständigt och tillsammans.
   

  

 I rollen har du naturligtvis stort stöd och nära samarbete med oss i Talent Acquisition teamet men bör trivas med stort mått av eget ansvar. För att du ska komma in i rollen på bästa tänkbara sätt får du en anpassad introduktion beroende på din erfarenhet och bakgrund.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi önskar oss en kollega som tycker om kontakt med människor, brinner för search och vill utvecklas inom området. Som Talent Sourcer är du lyhörd för rekryterande chefer och kollegor med ett tydligt kvalitetsfokus i dina dagliga prioriteringar. Som person är du självdriven, tar ägarskap över ditt arbete samt arbetar med struktur och noggrannhet. Du har förmåga att planera ditt eget arbete på ett realistiskt sätt.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Påbörjade högskole-universitetsstudier inom HR, personal eller relevant område (Examen tidigast juni 2027)
* Tidigare arbetserfarenhet av seacharbete, tech-rekryteringar eller search via Linkedin Recruiter är meriterande.
* Ett intresse för IT/tech är meriterande men viktigast är att du tycker om att bygga nätverk och etablera goda relationer med kandidater


 I rollen kommer du få sätta dig in i nya tjänster och varierande team, därför behöver du vara nyfiken och intresserad av att förstå olika roller och nya områden. Vi ser gärna att du, liksom vi, motiveras av utmaningar, höga mål och har ett stort fokus för att uppnå resultat. Du jobbar med hög energi och bidrar till ett positivt arbetsklimat och teamkänsla. Du är orädd och behöver stundtals vara både ihärdig och envis. I problem ser du lösningar och vid utmaningar tar du stöd av din kreativitet.
   

  

 Är du en person som vill jobba på ett företag med stort hjärta och tycker det är spännande att skapa nya relationer? Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Skicka din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök nu” under annonsen. Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast 24/8. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR. Kontakta gärna Linnea Zachrisson, Talent Acquisition Manager på Linnea.Zachrisson@avanza.se om du har några frågor om tjänsten.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.*
 Avanza är Sveriges ledande internetbank för sparande och placeringar. Vi drivs av att förändra branschen genom att utmana de stora bankerna och försäkringsbolagen på den svenska sparmarknaden. Vi vill vara tjänsten som förenklar och förbättrar spararnas ekonomi, oavsett om man älskar aktier eller bara vill ha ett bra sparande. Vår vision är att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor. Därför står våra kunders bästa alltid i fokus, precis som det borde vara. Affärsidén är enkel – mer till dig, mindre till banken. En idé som gett oss Sveriges nöjdaste sparare 15 år i rad.

title: Flygoperativ verksamhetsprocessägare till Stockholm Arlanda Airport
description:
Är du analytisk, engagerad och lösningsorienterad? Vill du spela en central roll i att utveckla och optimera Flygoperativa processen hos oss på Stockholm Arlanda Airport? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig!
   

  

 Placeringen på denna tjänst är Stockholm Arlanda Airport, med möjlighet till delvis distansarbete.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
 Som Flygoperativ verksamhetsprocessägare hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att analysera, utveckla och optimera flygoperativa processen samt att driva flygplatsen framåt. Du arbetar med ett kontinuerligt förbättringsarbete med full processorientering. Du arbetar nära olika avdelningar för att identifiera förbättringsområden, implementera lösningar och säkerställa att våra processer är effektiva, hållbara och kundfokuserade.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Kartlägga, analysera och förbättra befintliga processer för ökad effektivitet och kvalitet.
* Ansvarig för att risk- och kontinuitetsarbetet för processens syfte och mål är en integrerad del av processen.
* Leda och facilitera workshops för processutveckling tillsammans med både externa och interna intressenter.
* Implementera och följa upp förbättringsinitiativ baserat på data och verksamhetsmål.
* Framtagning av rekommendationer och förslag för riskreducerande åtgärder som resultat av avvikelseutredningar.
* Säkerställa att processer dokumenteras, standardiseras och följs upp enligt best practice.
* Bevaka lag och regelkrav (EASA, TSFS, Miljö, Arbetsmiljö mm) samt avtalsförändringar som berör eget verksamhetsområde.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom process och/eller logistik, eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av arbete med process- och logistikutveckling
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta processorienterat och med framtagande av KPI:er
* Kännedom om EASA-regelverket och insikt i flygtrafikledningens arbete och flygvägar
* Insikt i flygprocedurer – förståelse för deras syfte, utformning och praktiska tillämpning i operativ verksamhet
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Microsoft Office-paketet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


 Det är meriterande att ha god förståelse för flygoperativa system och processer kopplat till en flygplatsdrift och dess operativa miljö samt en förmåga att tolka och implementera nya och befintliga regelverk inom flygsektorn. Vi ser även gärna att du har god förståelse för IT´s roll i olika processer, inklusive funktioner, integrationer och systemkapabiliteter. Även B-körkort är meriterande.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen är du analytisk, strukturerad och lösningsfokuserad, med en förmåga att omvandla regelverk till praktiska och effektiva lösningar i det dagliga arbetet. Du trivs i en komplex miljö där du får bidra både strategiskt och operativt.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Du erbjuds ett arbete i en miljö i ständig förändring och utveckling där du får möjlighet att bidra med din kompetens. Flygplatserna präglas av högt engagemang hos medarbetarna där alla hjälps åt inom våra verksamhetsområden. Vi arbetar processorienterat för att bidra till en god leverans till våra kunder och skapa en väl fungerande arbetsplats med god stämning och bra arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Shirin Badri, shirin.badri@swedavia.se.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag är den 7 september, urval sker löpande och annonsen kan stängas tidigare så tveka inte att söka redan idag!**
**Hur är det att arbeta på Swedavia?**
 Vårt fokus är att möjliggöra hållbart resande och uppmuntra nytänkande för att skapa en välkomnande, trygg och inkluderande arbetsgemenskap där du kan växa och göra verklig skillnad – läs mer här! Jobba hos oss | Om Swedavia
   

  

 Då flygplatser är en säkerhetsklassad verksamhet genomgår samtliga kandidater som går vidare i rekryteringsprocessen en bakgrundskontroll. För vissa tjänster även en säkerhetsprövning. Swedavia är även en drogfri arbetsplats med nolltolerans mot droger. Drogtester genomförs före anställning och sker slumpmässigt under anställningen.

title: Master Data Specialist
description:
På Ahlsell kommer du till en varm kultur där våra värdeord enkelhet, ansvar och öppenhet genomsyrar vår verksamhet. Värdeorden beskriver hur vi arbetar och hur vi förhåller oss till kunder, leverantörer, samhället och inte minst, till varandra. Vill du vara med och göra skillnad? Vår vision på Ahlsell - Vi bygger ett mer hållbart samhälle - beskriver vad vår verksamhet och erbjudande syftar till. På Ahlsell är vi en del av våra kunders vardag, vi hjälper dem att göra det enklare att vara proffs. På Ahlsell är medarbetarna det viktigaste vi har och tillsammans med vårt engagemang och kunskap kan vi varje dag bli bättre än igår. För att trivas hos oss gillar du att jobba i en öppen, positiv och entreprenörsdriven kultur där du får möjlighet att växa och utvecklas. Helt enkelt ”den bästa tiden i ditt arbetsliv” – vårt medarbetarlöfte till dig!
   

  

 Information om våra produkter och leverantörer är kritiskt för att driva och utveckla affären hos Ahlsell. Vår nordiska Master Data funktion säkerställer korrekt data av rätt kvalitet för produkter och leverantörer. Vi har höga ambitioner inom Hållbarhet som kräver nya datapunkter och information av hög kvalitet och effektiv hantering. Vi driver ständig utveckling av metoder och processer och nu söker vi en Master Data Specialist som vill vara med och säkerställa, driva och utveckla detta spännande område.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 I rollen som Master Data Specialist hanterar Du infasning, underhåll och utfasning av artiklar och leverantörer. Du samarbetar med leverantörer och produktchefer för att säkerställa att verksamhetens krav på data samlas in och underhålls samt arbetar med regelbundna underhållsuppdrag. Rollen rapporterar till Master Data Manager i Sverige och är placerad på vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm (Marievik). Tjänsten kräver regelbunden närvaro på kontoret.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden**
* Underhåll av leverantörer, artiklar, priser och avtal.
* Aktivt bidra till ständiga förbättringar av processer och applikation genom att identifiera förbättringsområden.
* Samarbeta med masterdata-teamen inom koncernen för efterlevnad och utveckling av processer och metoder.
* Bidra till och stötta verksamheten med efterfrågad produkt och leverantörsinformation.


**Om Dig**
 Tjänsten ställer krav på att Du är stresstålig och ett dynamiskt och högt arbetstempo med självständigt arbete är något som Du uppskattar. Att ha struktur och ordning och reda i ditt dagliga arbete är en självklarhet för Dig och Du söker ständigt förbättringar och mer effektiva arbetssätt. Du är nyfiken och engagerad, kommunikativ och serviceinriktad och har lätt att se möjligheter och lösningar. Vid anställning lägger vi stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet. Det är meriterat om Du tidigare arbetat med produktdata, men inget krav. Det finns stora möjligheter för utveckling inom Master Data och Ahlsell. Viktigt är att Du har ett stort intresse av digital utveckling och datahantering.
   

  

**Du Har Kunskaper/erfarenhet Av**
* Mycket god Svenska och Engelska i tal & skrift
* Excel avancerad nivå
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT/Systemvetenskap eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet av ERP-system och PIM-system.


 Varmt välkommen med Din ansökan till oss. Du skickar in Din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen ansök nedan.
   

  

 Ahlsell finns där människor bor, arbetar och lever sina liv. Som ledande distributör av teknisk installation driver vi tillsammans med våra kunder utvecklingen för de som tillverkar, installerar, bygger, reparerar och underhåller. Med ett brett sortiment av hållbara produkter och tjänster, vår specialistkunskap och med logistik i världsklass är det vårt jobb att göra våra professionella kunders vardag enklare. Med en omsättning på ca 50 miljarder SEK, ca 7 500 medarbetare, över 300 butiker och fyra centrallager, gör vi allt för att uppfylla vårt kundlöfte: Ahlsell gör det enklare att vara proffs.

title: Field Sales Account Manager, Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
 The position comes with the responsibility of developing the presence of LEGO product ranges and the brand in the retail outlets within the designated region, in line with the plans set by sales leadership. Additionally, to optimise the action plans defined with national clients located within region in collaboration with key account management and to prioritise beneficial actions in points of sale with the highest traffic/ potential.
   

  

 \*\*\*\*There is no relocation support provided for this role\*\*\*\*
   

  

  

  
* Applications only considered with a CV/ resume in English – thank you\*\*\*\*


**Core Responsibilities**
  

  
* Management of customers by selling products and meeting customer needs via direct and indirect client visits.
* Drive commercial dialogues to secure contracts at regional level qualifying needs, expectations, and profile of the client recommending and processing orders
* Ensuring excellence in in-store execution aligned to company strategic priorities across all channels following up to inform, guide and secure long-term customer commitment.
* Collaborate with Key Account Managers to ensure the campaign plans are executed flawlessly, and maximize opportunities in store and on social media
* Attend customer fairs to build relations with the stores, handle customer orders, and sell-in campaigns
* Take ownership of the account planning processes including trade promotional and launch planning as well as commercial target management
* Focus sales efforts by studying existing and potential volume of customers/ channels and introduce promotional offers and resell according to national agreements.
* Indirect leadership and mentoring of a team of merchandisers offering the highest quality of brand expertise.


**Play your part in our team succeeding**
 This position sits in the Nordics Commercial Business Unit and is key to achieve theirs and the regions goals and ensures that our market leadership position is maintained in-country by building long-term relationships across different channels and achieving in-store execution excellence optimising the presence and performance of the LEGO brand and product ranges.
   

  

**Do you have what it takes?**
  

  
* A demonstrable experience as an established field-based Sales Representative role preferably in FMCG serving Stockholm based retailers.
* A target driven record in a field sales role with the ability to drive commercial business dialogue through data and insight to drive a compelling storyline.
* Proven ownership of relevant retailer and territory management accounts.
* Previous experience working across functions e.g., Key Account, Merchandising and Trade Marketing to implement in-store activations working in a collaborative and team spirited way.
* Proven commercial competence, prospecting, and presentation skills with an attention to detail and organisation (organisational strength is critical in this role).
* Very comfortable with commercial and digital tools (Microsoft Office, especially Excel, B2B, SAP...)
* Proficient in Swedish as well as business English, both are required day to day.
* Located in the same region (Stockholm) as the customer base is essential to conduct this role.
* Travel (via car) is required (minimum 3 days/week in the field, expectations are the role will be field based 80% of the time) plus 1 day every 2 weeks in our central Stockholm office.


**Join the global LEGO® team**
**What’s in it for you? Here are some of what to expect**
**Family Care Leave –** 
 We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.
   

  

**Insurances –** 
 All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.
   

  

**Wellness** 
 – We want you to be your best self, so you’ll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are based.
   

  

**Colleague** 
**Discount** 
 – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.
   

  

**Bonus** 
 – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached, you’ll be rewarded through our global bonus scheme.
   

  

 Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic, and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.
   

  

 The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of e.g., race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or gender identity.
   

  

 The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.
   

  

 Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.
   

  

**Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.**
 Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?**
 Here is what you can expect
   

  

**Family Care Leave** 
 - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.
   

  

**Insurances** 
 – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.
   

  

**Wellbeing** 
 - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.
   

  

**Colleague Discount** 
 – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.
   

  

**Bonus** 
 - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.
   

  

**Workplace** 
 - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.
   

  

 Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.
   

  

 The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.
   

  

 The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.
   

  

 Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.
   

  

 Just imagine building your dream career.
   

  

 Then make it real.
   

  

**Join the LEGO® team today.**

title: Client & Consulting Lead
description:
**About The Job**
 This is your unique opportunity to play a central role in defining digital roadmaps, nurturing high-level relationships, and steering complex programs with purpose and clarity. As a Senior Client & Consulting Lead, you will own client relationships and lead the charge on consulting engagements, while partnering with C-level leaders (CDOs, CMOs, CIOs, etc.), identifying new growth opportunities and ensuring project success and stakeholder alignment. Working hand-in-hand with our delivery teams, you will help clients unlock the power of digital to meet their ambitions today as well as into the future.
   

  

 The Senior Client & Consulting Lead position at IMPACT is for you, who thrives to:
   

  

* Turn ambition into action by designing bold digital strategies and roadmaps that truly move the needle for our clients.
* Lead the charge on high-impact consulting engagements in the fast-evolving worlds of retail, D2C, and omnichannel.
* Fuel growth by spotting and seizing opportunities to expand client partnerships through smart cross- and upselling initiatives.
* Be the trusted voice that digital leaders turn to guiding C-level decision-makers and middle managers alike with confidence and clarity.
* Inspire and align teams by orchestrating complex projects, delegating with purpose, and creating a collaborative, energized environment.
* Pitch ideas that win, shaping standout business proposals that captivate clients and deliver measurable results.
* Own the outcome, driving satisfaction, retention, and performance across a portfolio of clients generating €1–5M+ annually.


 YOUR PROFILE
   

  

 As Client & Consulting Lead, you are experienced within leading complex digital transformations, driving strategic consulting across retail, D2C, and omnichannel landscapes, while building strong, trust-based client relationships.
   

  

**Thus, We Expect You To Demonstrate**
* A strategic mindset with strong communication and analytical skills
* Experience with omnichannel, loyalty, personalization, and digital transformation
* Proven ability to drive business development and innovation to B2C clients
* Be a natural connector who builds trust with clients and teams alike


 We imagine you have 3–5 years' experience in management consulting or project/program leadership. Additionally, you could have an educational background within IT, business, finance, or management (BSc or MSc).
   

  

 Finally, we are looking for a colleague and team member who can contribute to a fun and professional work environment at IMPACT while ensuring a high standard in collaboration with your colleagues.
   

  

 LIFE AT IMPACT
   

  

 For more than 20 years, IMPACT has pioneered some of the most advanced commerce solutions in the Nordics. What started in Aarhus, Denmark has grown into a European powerhouse with offices across the world.
   

  

 While we cover all the major tech platforms and work with some of the most exciting businesses, we make a sincere effort to stay down-to-earth. It’s who we are, and it’s the kind of talent we want to attract. We empower people and businesses to drive positive change and quality experiences, and we’re not afraid to take the lead on shaping the future of commerce.
   

  

 Today, we’re a global team of digital talents working to strategize, craft, and support all things tech. We push the boundaries for commerce with curiosity, ambition, and empowerment that cements the ambition to
 **change commerce for the better** 
 . But it’s not all about size. Because more than anything, we want to maintain our collective can-do attitude that creates a working environment where everything is possible – and have fun while doing it.
   

  

 CONTACT
   

  

 Send your CV via the link below. Interviews are held on an ongoing basis, as the position is to be filled as soon as possible.
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 For more than 20 years, IMPACT has pioneered some of the most advanced commerce solutions in the Nordics. What started in Aarhus, Denmark has grown into a European powerhouse with offices across the world.
   

  

 Today, we’re a global team of digital talents working to strategize, craft, and support all things tech. We push the boundaries for commerce with curiosity, ambition, and empowerment that cements the ambition to
 **change commerce for the better** 
 . But it’s not all about size. Because more than anything, we want to maintain our collective can-do attitude that creates a working environment where everything is possible – and have fun while doing it.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 We are looking for a skilled Site Reliability Engineer to join our experienced SRE team and contribute to exciting projects from the fintech industry. You will play a key role in shaping the financial sector with innovative cloud native solutions.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
* Design, build, and maintain our AWS cloud infrastructure (EKS, MSK, RDS Aurora, Lambdas, DynamoDB, S3, CloudFront) using Terraform.
* Manage and enhance our CI/CD pipelines using GitLab CI, enabling rapid and reliable software delivery.
* Automate infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and deployment processes.
* Implement and manage our observability platform (Datadog) with Terraform.
* Collaborate with software engineers to ensure our applications are designed for scalability, reliability, and easy deployment.
* Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement solutions to ensure high availability and performance.
* Contribute to the development and maintenance of our Go based backend services and internal tools.
* Champion DevOps best practices, including Infrastructure as Code (IaC), configuration management, and continuous monitoring.
* Participate in 24/7 on-call rotation and respond to incidents to maintain service uptime.
* Focus on security best practices across our infrastructure and applications (Web and AWS security).


**Tooling ⚙️**
* GitLab, DataDog, Incident.io, Auth0
* Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Traefik,
* Terraform, Go, Bash
* AWS - EKS,RDS Aurora, MSK, S3, Cloudfront, DynamoDB, Lambda


**Qualifications 👑**
* Proven experience as a Site Reliability Engineer or in a similar role.
* Hands-on experience with AWS services, including EKS, MSK, RDS (Aurora Postgres), Lambdas, DynamoDB, S3, or CloudFront.
* Proficient in Terraform for infrastructure provisioning and management across various services (AWS, Datadog, Auth0).
* Solid understanding and practical experience with GitLab/GitHub (or similar) for source control and CI/CD pipelines.
* Ability to read and write code, with a strong preference for experience in Go. Scripting skills (e.g., Bash, Python) are also valuable.
* Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a startup-paced environment.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days, awsome!
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Senior Amazon Brand Manager
description:
GNO Partners was founded by Gal and Ouriel, who built and exited two successful Amazon brands. We help Amazon FBA sellers scale profitably using our proven system.
   

  

 We are a Done With You consultancy, meaning we don't manage client accounts - we set the strategy, analyze their brand, and teach them how to execute using our resources.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
* Fully remote Amazon consulting agency.
* High-performance culture: hard work, speed, over-delivery, and trust.
* Competitive Compensation: Total OTE of $210,000-250,000+. Base Salary: $100,000+ Performance-Based Earnings: $100,000-$150,000+, based on performance, with no cap on earnings.
* Work with a team that lives and breathes Amazon while having fun doing it.


**Who We're Looking For:**
 We are seeking a Senior Amazon Brand Manager who deeply understands Amazon FBA, enjoys strategizing for brand growth, and can tackle complex challenges with precision and speed.Key Skills & Experience:
   

  

* Organic Ranking Mastery: Product launches, ranking strategies, and algorithm insights.
* Amazon PPC Expertise: Strategy + execution, proven hands on experience managing minimum $50K+/mo budgets.
* Brand Management: Experience managing Private Label brands generating a minimum of $10M in annual revenue
* Logistics & Backend: Strong grasp of COGs, fees, inventory, and profitability (P&L) optimization.
* Amazon Catalog Troubleshooter: Proven expertise in diagnosing and resolving complex catalog issues.


**Responsibilities:**
* Lead weekly strategy calls with clients, ensuring project progress.
* Solve Amazon challenges and guide clients through key projects.
* Track progress and provide clear next steps.
* Offer daily support via Slack & Email.
* Continuously improve our consulting systems.
* Attend weekly training and team meetings.


**Qualifications:**
* Full-time, remote.
* 3+ years Amazon FBA experience, managing brands $10M+ in revenue minimum.
* PPC expertise: Managed $50k monthly ad budgets minimum.
* Seller Central pro: Navigate and optimize quickly.
* Strong project management & client communication skills.
* Positive, proactive, and client-focused personality.
* Fluent in English.
* Ambitious and driven, with a relentless work ethic to maximize earning potential


 If you're an Amazon expert, you're driven, strategic, and thrive in high-growth environments, we want you on our team!

title: Integrationsutvecklare - sökes till Accelerate at Iver
description:
*Nu letar vi efter nya medarbetare som vill vara med på vår resa. Som en del av Accelerate at Iver ligger du i teknikens absoluta framkant och arbetar med spännande digitaliserings- och transformationsprojekt hos marknadsledande kunder. Vi är idag över 300 konsulter som brinner för att realisera digitala möjligheter i molnet. Tillsammans med våra kunder stänger vi gapet mellan aspiration och framgångsrik implementation. Nu söker vi en Integrationsutvecklare som vill bli en del av Accelerate at Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?*
**Din roll** 
**på Accelerate at Iver?**
 Som integrationsutvecklare hos Accelerate at Iver kommer du att bidra till att bygga robusta, moderna och långsiktiga integrationslösningar. Lösningarna byggs främst på Microsoft-teknologi, både cloud och on-prem.
   

  

 Vi söker en social och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har ett stort driv och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad inom den senaste tekniken.
   

  

 Vill du vara en del av vårt team och bidra till att bygga framtidens integrationslösningar?
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Utveckling & Implementering: Erfarenhet av att ta fram teknisk och funktionell design för integrationslösningar. Samarbeta med integrationsarkitekter för att utveckla lösningar som uppfyller både verksamhetsmål och tekniska principer.
* Kodkvalitet & Optimering: Säkerställ högkvalitativ, underhållbar och återanvändbar kod. Förbättra befintliga integrationer för att uppnå bättre skalbarhet, säkerhet och prestanda.
* Samarbete: Arbeta självständigt eller i team tillsammans med bland annat projektledare, arkitekter, testare och produktägare.
* Support & Underhåll: Bidra till det löpande underhållet och utvecklingen av integrationslösningar.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Accelerate at Iver kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.
   

  

 Hos Accelerate at Iver får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med C#, .Net Core och Microservices i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.
   

  

 Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik.
   

  

 Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver får du ett antal fördelar som:
   

  

* En trygg och säker anställning
* Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Hälso & sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Pensions och försäkringsrådgivning
* Förmånsportal
* Timbank & volontärdag
* Medarbetar och familjeaktiviteter i olika former


**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
 Erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknologier som:
   

  

* C#, .NET Core, .NET Framework, XML, JSON, REST-APIer, Biceps
* Azure Integration Services: Logic Apps, Service Bus, Azure Functions, Azure API Management
* SQL Server, Azure SQL
* Azure, men meriterande med erfarenhet av andra plattformar såsom BizTalk, Mulesoft eller andra plattformar


 Kunskap om verktyg som Microsoft Visual Studio/Visual Studio Code, Postman, Git och Azure DevOps.
   

  

 Minst 2–4 års erfarenhet inom integrationsutveckling
   

  

 Du bör ha jobbat i agila team med scrum- eller kanban som arbetssätt, och vara van vid de olika rollerna och rollfördelningen som ett sådant arbetssätt innebär.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.
   

  

 Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!
   

  

 För denna position krävs Svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige & Norge. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Accelerate at Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Accelerate at Iver!

title: Product Owner (PO) for Global Outbound Logistics
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Background**
 Scania is transforming from a manufacturer of trucks and buses into a provider of complete and sustainable transport solutions. The Global Outbound team ensures that our vehicles reach customers worldwide through smart, scalable logistics systems. As we modernize our system landscape, we’re looking for a senior Product Owner (PO) to lead the development, operations, and transition of our outbound logistics systems – including the current and future TMS, and related integrations.
   

  

 This role is key to our digital evolution and will operate in a complex technical and stakeholder environment, with legacy systems in place, decentralized user organizations, SaaS suppliers, and a joint future system being built together with MAN under the TRATON umbrella.
   

  

**Your Mission**
 As Product Owner, you will be responsible for maximizing the business value delivered by our logistics applications. You will own the system roadmap and collaborate closely with our Agile development team, external SaaS vendors, and global stakeholders. This role requires strong skills in vendor management, expectation alignment, and balancing diverse regional needs into unified solutions that serve the company-wide strategy. You will drive continuous improvement, ensure structured change handling, coordinate releases, and support operational excellence in our outbound logistics flows. You’ll navigate multi-brand, multi-market, and multi-system challenges, ensuring high performance today while preparing for tomorrow.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* System Lifecycle Ownership: Own, prioritize, and maintain the product roadmap/backlog for TMS, Integration Layer, and other key applications, ensuring business alignment and value delivery, including development, operations, upgrades, ramp-up and ramp-down. Work within an Agile setup to ensure clear requirements, prioritization, testing, and deployment.
* Supplier & SaaS Management: Act as a key counterpart to external vendors delivering our SaaS logistics systems. Ensure quality, compliance with agreements, and continuous development.
* Stakeholder Management: Engage a global network of stakeholders from Sweden, France, Netherlands, Poland, Brazil, and China. Understand varying needs and translate them into globally beneficial and scalable solutions.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with logistics operations, IT, application product owners, business architects, solution architects, and digitalisation teams to ensure business processes and supporting systems evolve together.
* Change & Release Management: Lead structured change processes for new features, system rollouts, and migrations. Ensure documentation, impact assessments, training, and communication plans are executed effectively.
* Continuous Improvement: Drive enhancements and capability development based on user feedback, performance analysis, and strategic needs.
* Operational Support: Collaborate with support and business teams to ensure operational stability and high system availability.
* Strategic Projects: Support large-scale initiatives such as China and TRATON projects by ensuring that digital solutions are locally relevant and globally aligned.
* SaaS & Legacy Transition Management: Drive the transition from current SaaS suppliers to the future Scania-MAN solution. Ensure business continuity, current system decommissioning, and readiness for global rollout.
* Cross-Brand Architecture & Integration: Collaborate with architects and solution teams to manage complex integrations between TMS, ERP, WMS, OMS, and other systems across Scania and MAN.
* Governance and Compliance: Ensure that solutions comply with Scania's and TRATON governance models, quality standards, data security, GDPR, audit standards, and sustainability goals.


**Your profile**
 We are looking for a senior professional with a proven track record in IT product ownership within international organizations. You are strategic, hands-on, and comfortable navigating both technical detail and stakeholder politics in a fast-evolving logistics environment.
   

  

**Educational Background:** 
 Degree in Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management, IT, or a related field.
   

  

**Experience:**
* 5–10 years as Product Owner, IT Product Manager, or senior Digital Delivery Lead.
* SaaS lifecycle management. Supplier transition leadership is considered a strong plus.
* ERP and/or logistics system landscape experience (e.g., SAP, TMS, WMS).
* Integration and IT architecture understanding (e.g., APIs, EDI, data flows).
* Stakeholder management across global organizations.
* Leading system rollouts, migrations, or IT transformation projects.


**Technical Skills:**
* Agile methodologies (Scrum, SAFe); knowledge of Jira and/or Confluence is a plus.
* Strong understanding of large-scale operational platforms.
* Cloud SaaS model awareness (e.g., SLAs, vendor negotiation).
* Knowledge of transport-related systems considered a strong plus (e.g. TMS, WMS, ERP, OMS).
* Exposure to SAP S/4HANA transition is considered a strong plus.


**Core Competencies:**
* Leadership & Influence: Confident leading teams and aligning stakeholders in a multi-cultural and multi-geography environment.
* Problem Solving: Ability to address root causes, remove blockers, and create clarity from ambiguity.
* Self-Driven: Proactive, structured, and able to work independently while ensuring results.
* Resilience & Adaptability: Thrives in uncertain, changing, and complex environments.


**Language:**
* Must have: English (fluent)
* Nice to have: additional language within Scania’s main locations (Swedish, Portuguese, Dutch, French, etc.).


**Other Information:**
* Travel: Occasional travel across Scania’s global locations is required.
* Having the following certifications is considered a strong plus:
+ SAFe Product Owner/Product Manager (POPM) or similar Agile certifications.
+ PROSCI or formal change management training.
+ TOGAF or similar enterprise architecture framework exposure.


**Want to Make an Impact?**
 You will be at the heart of Scania’s digital logistics transformation, helping shape how we serve customers globally. If you're ready to lead in complexity and drive meaningful change, we look forward to your application. Come and join us to leave a mark and drive the shift!
   

  

**Scania offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Please submit your application before September 5th. Your application should include a CV, Cover letter and relevant education certificates/transcripts. Candidates assessment will be ongoing and this ad may be closed earlier. A background check may be conducted as part of the recruitment process.
   

  

 For more information:
   

  

 If you have questions, don’t hesitate to reach out to Fernando dos Santos, fernando.x.dos.santos@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Global Paid Media Strategist
description:
**Grow with us**
**About Ericsson:**
 At Ericsson, we are shaping the future of connectivity and technology. As a
 **Global Senior Media Strategist** 
 , you’ll be at the heart of digital media innovation, helping to drive real impact for one of the world’s most recognized technology brands. You’ll work in a dynamic, forward-thinking environment where strategic vision, creativity, and data-driven decision-making come together.
   

  

**Global Paid Media Strategist – Ericsson**
 Are you passionate about delivering impactful paid media campaigns on a global stage? Ericsson is looking for a Global Paid Media Strategist to help shape and execute our paid and social media activities, ensuring innovative, data-driven, and effective campaigns across digital channels.
   

  

 This role is part of the Paid & Social Media team within Group Function Marketing, reporting to the Global Head of Paid & Social Media. You’ll play an important role in advancing Ericsson’s digital media excellence, making sure our paid media investments drive engagement, efficiency, and business growth.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Paid Media Strategy & Innovation
* Support the development and execution of global paid media strategies in line with Ericsson’s business priorities.
* Identify opportunities to test new ideas, formats, and platforms, including AI and automation.
* Keep up to date with paid media trends, audience behaviors, and platform innovations.
* Ensure paid media activations reflect our brand and maintain a high level of creativity.
* Paid & Social Media Execution
* Coordinate the planning, activation, and optimization of paid campaigns across key channels (e.g., LinkedIn, Meta, programmatic, SEM).
* Help manage content distribution and audience engagement on social platforms.
* Collaborate with internal teams to align paid media with global marketing campaigns and events.
* Work closely with media agencies and partners to ensure performance and efficiency.
* Performance Measurement & Optimization
* Contribute to measurement frameworks, ensuring campaigns are insight-led and data-driven.
* Partner with analytics teams to review results and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Support testing initiatives to refine targeting, creative formats, and budget allocation.
* Help ensure brand safety and compliance in all paid media activities.
* Collaboration & Knowledge Sharing
* Work with regional teams and business units to ensure alignment and consistency in paid media approach.
* Share knowledge on paid media trends, tools, and best practices with colleagues.
* Foster a collaborative, curious, and forward-looking approach to paid media planning and execution.


**Skills You Bring**
* Around 4–6 years of experience in paid media strategy, planning, or activation, preferably in a B2B or technology-driven environment.
* Comfortable working with data to inform decisions and optimize performance.
* Experience working with agencies and media technology partners.
* Collaborative and communicative, with the ability to work effectively across teams and regions.
* A proactive problem-solver who brings both creative and analytical thinking.


**Why Join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, we’re shaping the future of connectivity and technology. As a Global Paid Media Strategist, you’ll play a key role in delivering innovative campaigns for one of the world’s most recognized technology brands. You’ll work in a supportive, forward-thinking environment where creativity, collaboration, and data-driven decision-making come together.
   

  

 This is a full-time position starting as soon as possible, based in Stockholm, Kista, with a hybrid work model. Ready to make an impact in paid media? Apply now and help us take our campaigns to the next level.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Job details:** 
 External Activation and Engagement
   

  

**Job Stage:** 
 Job Stage 7
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 Menna Belacevic
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 Jennie Arvenäs

title: SALES ADVISORS – UNIQLO KUNGSTRÄDGÅRDEN STORE, PART-TIME
description:
UNIQLO is a Japanese company dedicated to creating great clothing with new and unique value to enrich the lives of people everywhere.
   

  

 Each and every one of our stores are a unique shopping destination with service minded staff members who are prepared to always give our customers a pleasant and memorable experience.
   

  

 Are you the new Sales advisor we are looking for to match our values?
   

  

 We are seeking individuals who aspire to grow and develop into true professionals. At UNIQLO, teamwork is essential. We encourage team members to take initiative and actively participate in all aspects of our business.
   

  

 If you welcome the challenge of being part of this exciting adventure, have a drive for success and embrace a business owner mindset – then, you belong at UNIQLO!
   

  

****What will you do?****
* Provide outstanding customer service.
* Deal with product deliveries and shipments, create visual displays and perform cleaning
* Ensure smooth operations and minimise loss.
* Collaborate enthusiastically with all team members and offer to support them when needed to form a united high performing team.


****What do you need to succeed in this position?****
* You have a passion for UNIQLO brand and products. You will be our ambassador.
* You are service minded with a great ability to work in a fast paced environment.
* You are a true team player with a positive mindset.
* You have excellent communication skills and high level of English. Swedish and/or Scandinavian languages are an advantage.
* Flexible to work on weekends and across various shifts.
* You have the right to work in Sweden. We do not sponsor work visa.
* Previous experience in retail is not mandatory however, it is an advantage


****What are we offering in return?****
* Temporary part-time contracts (24h/w) starting during September
* The possibility to join a company that with great career development possibilities.
* Diverse team every day.
* Employment conditions that follows the collective agreement within retail.


 Join and grow the number of UNIQLO’s fans in Scandinavia! Please submit your CV written in English as soon as possible - interviews are being held ongoing.
   

  

 Please expect an update from us on your application within 2-3 weeks (due to the volume of applications we receive, we apologize for not being able to give personalized feedback to all candidates).
   

  

 UNIQLO is an inclusive employer and we welcome applications from all profiles, regardless of age, race, gender, sexual orientation, disabilities or background.
   

  

 We take data protection very seriously and understand the importance of protecting your privacy and Personal Information. For the recruitment process, you can find the applicable privacy policy on our site:
   

  

 https://www.fastretailing.com/eng/privacy/eurecruitment.html

title: Valsamordnare
description:
I Upplands-Bro kommun är vi cirka 2000 medarbetare som arbetar med att ge våra invånare och besökare bästa möjliga service och upplevelse av kommunen. Hos oss är du med och bygger en kommun där helhetssyn, engagemang och professionalitet genomsyrar organisationen och tillsammans arbetar vi med att utföra det gemensamma samhällsuppdraget.
   

  

**Vill du leda arbetet för demokrati och inkludering?**
 Nu söker vi dig som vill ta ett viktigt steg in i demokratins tjänst och bidra till trygga, rättssäkra och tillgängliga val. Upplands-Bro kommun söker en engagerad och organiserad valsamordnare som vill ha en nyckelroll inför kommande val till riksdag, kommun- och regionfullmäktige.
   

  

 Som valsamordnare har du huvudansvaret för att planera, samordna, genomföra och följa upp val till riksdag, kommun- och regionfullmäktige på ett säkert, rättssäkert och tillgängligt sätt för alla röstberättigade.
   

  

 Efter valet kommer rollen att övergå till en kombinerad tjänst som
 **nämndkoordinator/valsamordnare** 
 , där du får en central funktion i kommunens demokratiska processer även framåt.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 I rollen som valsamordnare ansvarar du för att planera, samordna, genomföra och följa upp val till riksdag, kommun- och regionfullmäktige. Du projektleder hela valprocessen, arbetsleder valkansliet och rekryterar samt utbildar cirka 150 röstmottagare. Du säkerställer att det finns tillgång till vallokaler och lokaler för förtidsröstning, beställer och hanterar valmaterial, bereder ärenden till valnämnden och planerar informationsinsatser till allmänheten. Arbetet innebär också ett nära samarbete med både interna och externa aktörer för att skapa en trygg och rättssäker valupplevelse för alla röstberättigade.
   

  

 Som nämndkoordinator blir du en central länk mellan politik och tjänstemannaorganisation. Du ansvarar för hela mötesprocessen – från ärendeuttag och beredning inför sammanträden till efterbehandling och dokumentation. I uppdraget ingår att vara sekreterare vid möten, administrera nämndsprocessen och tillsammans med kollegor utveckla rutiner, processer och digitala arbetssätt. Rollen innebär också att du samarbetar i team med kommun- och nämndkoordinatorer och stöttar vid arbetstoppar eller frånvaro.
   

  

 Oavsett uppdrag har du en koordinerande funktion där du driver processer framåt, säkerställer kvalitet och bidrar till att skapa tydliga, effektiva och rättssäkra arbetsflöden i kommunens demokratiska processer.
   

  

**Vem vi söker**
 Vi söker dig som är strukturerad, samarbetsinriktad och lösningsfokuserad, och som vill bidra till en stark och levande demokrati i kommunen. Du trivs i en koordinerande roll där du håller ihop många delar samtidigt, och du har förmåga att både se helheten och hantera detaljerna. Som person tar du egna initiativ, är trygg i att leda andra och har lätt för att skapa goda relationer. Du behöver också kunna växla mellan strategiskt arbete, där planering och långsiktig struktur står i fokus, och operativa insatser i vardagen.
   

  

*Krav för tjänsten:*
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av projektledning, gärna i komplexa uppdrag
* Akademisk utbildning, exempelvis inom statsvetenskap, samhällsvetenskap eller annan inriktning som vi bedömer likvärdig
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska, både i tal och skrift
* Goda IT-kunskaper och vana att arbeta i Officeprogrammen
* B-körkort


*Det är meriterande om du har:*
* Tidigare erfarenhet av arbete som valsamordnare eller i valadministration
* Erfarenhet av arbete som nämnd- eller kommunsekreterare
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem
* Arbetslivserfarenhet från kommun eller annan offentlig verksamhet


**Vad erbjuder vi**
 Hos oss får du ett dynamiskt och utvecklande arbete mitt i det politiska beslutsfattandet, där du är med och skapar förutsättningar för en stark och rättssäker demokrati. Du får möjlighet att ta del av kanslienhetens breda uppdrag och kan, utifrån intresse, också bredda din yrkesroll inom andra ansvarsområden. Vi erbjuder flexibla arbetstider och friskvårdsbidrag som en del av våra förmåner. Din arbetsplats blir i kommunhuset i Kungsängens centrum, precis intill pendeltågsstationen. Härifrån tar det knappt 30 minuter med tåg från Stockholm C, med avgångar var 15:e minut.
   

  

**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Vi ser fram emot att ta emot din ansökan senast den 14 september 2025. Ansökan görs enkelt genom att bifoga ditt CV – något personligt brev behöver du inte skicka in. I stället ber vi dig besvara våra urvalsfrågor, vilket ger oss en tydlig bild av din kompetens och erfarenhet redan i ett tidigt skede.
   

  

 De kandidater som uppfyller skallkraven, det vill säga den utbildning, kunskap och erfarenhet som efterfrågas, kommer att bjudas in till en första kort digital intervju. Därefter går de som går vidare till en fysisk intervju med kompetensbaserade frågor. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande under annonseringsperioden.
   

  

 Innan anställningsavtal kan tecknas kommer en bakgrundskontroll och säkerhetsprövning att genomföras på slutkandidaten. Provanställning kommer att tillämpas.
   

  

*Alla erbjudanden om annonsering och hjälp i rekryteringsprocessen undanbedes.*
**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Upplands-Bro kommun är en av Sveriges mest expansiva kommuner där utveckling står i centrum. Vi välkomnar dig till en arbetsplats där ledorden i vårt arbete och förhållningssätt är Helhetssyn, Engagemang och Professionalitet.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Upplands-Bro | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/214 | Kontakt: Walid Ahmed 08-58169000, | Facklig företrädare: Fackliga representanter via kommunens växel 08-58169000, | Publicerat: 2025-08-22 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-09-14

title: Experienced Auditor
description:
Do you want to be part of a team that is developing tomorrow's businesses and organizations? At PwC, we strive to be proactive advisors that really make a difference in society. We see that experience and knowledge are invaluable assets, so it's crucial to us that you contribute with your expertise to promote PwC's development. Together, we create a meaningful and rewarding career for you.
   

  

**Become part of PwC's audit operations**
 As an employee in audit, you work to identify risks, solve complex audit questions, analyze data and draw conclusions about the information presented by our customers. You get to work in inspiring and meaningful assignments where our work affects our customers' business operations, but also contributes to creating trust in society.
   

  

 The digital development and increased demands for transparency contribute to the fact that the audit of the future will require more multifaceted competence than before, which also provides more opportunities for specialization. At PwC, working as an auditor can look very different and this means that you can create your own career path. You can choose to become a customer manager or immerse yourself in a specialist area such as data analysis, sustainability reporting, internal control or invest in a career as a leader.
   

  

**Who are you?**
**We Are Looking For You Who Have**
* At least 10 years of experience working with auditing and/or qualified financial statement work.
* Experience from any firm within Big4.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.


 We attach great importance to your personal qualities and therefore believe that you:
   

  

* Is service oriented and motivated by delivering results and meeting our customers' expectations.
* Is adaptable, can read situations and adapt both behavior and communication in building qualitative and diversified relationships.
* Acts with integrity by being straightforward and honest in communication and is easy to get others on board with
* Has good analytical skills and is solution-oriented. You enjoy learning new things and are curious about digitization and new technology to be able to solve customers' needs.
* Has interpersonal skills and the ability to create relationships and networks. These skills are needed to work well with our clients, but are of course also important for collaboration within our team.
* Is structured, efficient and organized.


 ,
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 We will review applications continuously, and the position may be filled earlier than the application deadline.
   

  

**Please Attach The Following Documents To Your Application**
* CV


 We believe in the strength of having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection. The tests are the first step in our selection process. You will receive a link to these tests after we have received your application.
   

  

 We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. We call for interviews continuously, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

title: Grävmaskinist till TKBM Entreprenad AB
description:
TKBM Entreprenad AB är ett modernt entreprenadföretag med ca 25 anställda. Vi har arbeten runt om i Storstockholm med ett huvudkontor i Länna, Huddinge kommun.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som är en van och självgående maskinförare och med minst några års yrkeserfarenhet. Du skall behärska yrket väl och lägga stor vikt vid att det blir rätt gjort från början. Vi tror att du tycker att maskiner är roligt och drivs av att se resultatet av ditt arbete. Du är van att planera ditt arbete från start till slut och kan tänka till vad som kommer behövas under tiden.
 



  





 Som person skall du trivas med att arbete självständigt men inte ha några problem att samarbeta tillsammans med en yrkesarbetare, vi söker en lagspelare som vill vara med och bygga teamet tillsammans med oss.
 



  





 Du skall även behärska det svenska språket flytande i tal och skrift.
 



 Då vi är ett modernt och miljömedvetet företag ser vi gärna att du har god IT kompetens, då vi arbetar digitalt med tidrapportering och projektuppföljning.
 



  





 Vidare tror vi att du har en del utbildningar inom mark och anläggning, dessa är meriterande:
 



 Maskinförarbevis
 



 Arbete på väg 1.1-1.3 ( 2.1, 2.2)
 



 HLR
 



 ESA Instruerad person
 



 Heta arbeten
 



 EBR KJ41Kabelförläggning
 



 Körkort B är KRAV. Körkort BE är meriterande.
 



  





 Arbetsplatsen kan komma att variera inom Storstockholm.
 



 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bestå av schaktning, återställning och finplanering, samt övrigt vanligt förekommande arbetsuppgifter.
 



 Du kommer att få ett stort eget ansvar och se till att uppgiften blir korrekt utfört, därför lägger vi stor vikt vid din kompetens och vilja.
 



  





 Vi har kollektivavtal med ME- Maskinföraravtalet
 



 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
 



 Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista svarsdatum, så välkommen in med din ansökan redan nu!

title: Head of People Analytics & Reward
description:
We are on a mission to become the leading force in residential property management services. The global residential property management industry is currently undergoing a digital transformation and Odevo is at the forefront of this transformation. Our mission is to radically simplify living for families and individuals by delivering highly attractive and efficient property management services to building owners and associations as well as to residents. Our core belief is that digital technology combined with great people will play a central role in delivering a step change in how boards and residents experience property management.
   

  

 What we do matters to billions of people across the world. Residential real estate is the world’s largest asset class and buying a home is often the biggest investment a person or family will ever make. But the residential property management industry is lagging behind when it comes to customer focus and digitalization. That is why we formed Odevo.
   

  

 Leading property management companies in the Nordics, UK, and US have already joined forces to form Odevo and over the last 4 years Odevo’ s revenues have grown 40-fold to become a leading international player. Our ambition is to continue to grow rapidly organically and by attracting additional companies to join us in both existing and new markets.
   

  

 We deliver our property management services with custom developed software to simplify living and make life easier for property owners, association boards, residents and very importantly our own property management professionals. We make complex topics such as managing property finances and the daily maintenance of buildings easy, and we automate time-consuming everyday tasks so people can spend more time on things that they really enjoy.
   

  

 We are a 7500 employee company with a start-up mentality. We aspire to break new ground through innovation, and we actively cultivate a workplace where we can grow as individuals and have fun while achieving great things together.
   

  

 To continue our ambitious growth journey, we are now looking for people who share our vision to join us on a journey that will continue to transform the property management industry on a global scale.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Odevo is experiencing rapid growth, and to enhance our shared People & Performance initiatives, we are seeking a strategic and experienced Head of People Analytics & Reward to shape and drive Odevo’s global approach to people data and insights across markets and companies.
   

  

 You will create the conditions for impactful decision-making by leveraging strategic people data and analytics, enabling the organization to align talent strategies with business goals and drive long-term success.
   

  

 You will report to the Group Chief People Officer and collaborate closely with the Group People & Performance team, as well as stakeholders across all markets.
   

  

**Examples Of Areas Of Responsibilities Include**
* Lead projects to enhance the utilization of people data and improve company insights, while staying updated on the latest trends in people analytics, AI, and automation.
* Create and manage People KPI dashboards to visualize impactful data and enable informed decision-making. Conduct in-depth analysis of key people metrics to uncover trends and insights, helping drive strategic decisions. Streamline processes for monthly, quarterly, and HR reporting to enhance efficiency across the Group.
* Manage and optimize processes related to rewards and benefits, and performance management metrics, as well as oversee bonus schemes. Collaborate with People Partners and Payroll on salary reviews and pay equity analyses, salary benchmarks.
* Design structures for compliance and ESG reporting across the Group. Ensure GDPR compliance and adherence to data minimization principles in all data handling processes.
* Act on various HR inquiries from the organization related to reward and benefits and HR compliance.


**Who You Are**
* Analytical Thinker: You possess a keen ability to analyze complex data sets and extract meaningful insights that drive strategic decisions.
* Detail-Oriented: Your meticulous attention to detail ensures accuracy and reliability in all data reporting and analysis.
* Problem Solver: You thrive on finding creative solutions to enhance HR processes and systems, leveraging the latest trends in analytics and automation.
* Collaborative: You work seamlessly with diverse teams across markets and companies, fostering strong relationships and driving collective success.
* Proactive: You take initiative in leading projects and optimizing processes, always staying ahead of industry trends and best practices.
* Effective Communicator: You articulate complex data insights clearly and effectively, enabling informed decision-making at all levels of the organization.


**Experience**
* Extensive experience in People Analytics, People Operations, and Rewards & Benefits strategy.
* Background in diverse companies, international settings, and/or matrix organizations—offering a broad perspective and strong stakeholder management across multiple projects.
* Solid understanding of data analysis and management, with the ability to clearly visualize complex information.
* Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint; preferably experienced with tools like Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
* University degree.


**Excited?**
 Get in touch! We look forward to receiving your application! If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Maja Frick, Talent Partner at Odevo.
   

  

 #msl

title: Private Equity Performance Improvement - (Senior) Director
description:
**About Alvarez & Marsal** 




  










 Alvarez & Marsal (A&M) is a global consulting firm with over 10,000 entrepreneurial, action and results-oriented professionals in over 40 countries. We take a hands-on approach to solving our clients' problems and assisting them in reaching their potential. Our culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&M's core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are why our people love working at A&M.
 



  










**The Team** 





  










 A&M’s PEPI practice works with private equity investors and their portfolio companies to deliver independent analysis and end-to-end services across the investment lifecycle. The team specializes in operational and commercial due diligence, post-merger integration, performance improvement, and transformation. A&M’s proprietary Rapid Results Program helps quickly assess business process risks and identify key areas impeding performance.
 



 This role offers the opportunity to work with PE-owned portfolio companies, addressing underperformance, reorganization, and repositioning challenges, while maximizing value for stakeholders.
 



  










**How you will contribute** 




  




* Lead a wide range of projects, including operational/commercial due diligence, post-merger integration, performance improvement, and interim management.
* Advise and implement performance improvement programs for major corporations across various industries.
* Evaluate cost reduction and revenue enhancement opportunities.
* Oversee post-acquisition work to ensure operational due diligence (ODD) findings are realized quickly and effectively.
* Develop and execute 100-day plans, ensuring clarity, ownership, and delivery of growth and cost reduction goals.
* Support PE-owned businesses in improving financial and operational performance.
* Work on complex operational issues, including manufacturing, supply chain management, logistics, and purchasing.
* Contribute to business development, including creating successful pitches and transitioning from diagnostic phases to implementation work.
* Develop and implement new operating plans to improve business performance.



  










**Qualifications** 




  





**Essential:** 




  




* Proven experience working with private equity-backed portfolio companies, with expertise in transformation, PMI, and due diligence.
* Extensive knowledge of international operations, including manufacturing, supply chain management, purchasing, and logistics.
* Track record of delivering major assignments at pre- and post-deal stages.
* Strong understanding of operational KPIs, balanced scorecards, and continuous improvement processes.
* Expertise in LEAN production philosophy and holistic performance improvement projects.
* Effective communicator with the ability to engage leadership teams in high-pressure situations.
* Degree from an accredited university.
* Fluency in Swedish and English (business level).



  





**Desirable:** 




  




* MBA or financial qualification.
* Additional European languages.
* Cross-sector experience in industries such as telecommunications, automotive, manufacturing, energy, retail, consumer goods, transport, business services, or healthcare.



  





**Your journey at A&M** 




  





 We recognize that our people are the driving force behind our success, which is why we prioritize an employee experience that fosters each person’s unique professional and personal development. Our robust performance development process promotes continuous learning, rewards your contributions, and fosters a culture of meritocracy. With top-notch training and on-the-job learning opportunities, you can acquire new skills and advance your career.
 



  





 We prioritize your well-being, providing benefits and resources to support you on your personal journey. Our people consistently highlight the growth opportunities, our unique, entrepreneurial culture, and the fun we have together as their favorite aspects of working at A&M. The possibilities are endless for high-performing and passionate professionals.
 



  





**Inclusive Diversity** 




  





 A&M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity, and we foster inclusiveness, encouraging everyone to bring their whole self to work each day. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&M way.
 



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




  





 It is Alvarez & Marsal’s practice to provide and promote equal opportunity in employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination because of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, sex or gender, gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, family medical history, genetic information or other protected medical condition, political affiliation, or any other characteristic protected by and in accordance with applicable laws. Employees and Applicants can find A&M policy statements and additional information by region here.
 



  





**Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters** 




  





 Please note that as per A&M policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters are engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that A&M will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

title: Senior Data Scientist, Digital Sales Personal Banking
description:
**Job ID: 28047**
 Would you like to empower business professionals to unlock the potential of data? We are growing our team in Data, Digital Sales and Engagement (DDSE) Sweden. We are now locking for a data scientist who can help us to utilise more data and insight to engage with customers in different interactions.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 In Data, Digital Sales and Engagement (DDSE) we are a group of specialists in various fields: everything from digital marketing and content production to web analysis and data science. Collectively, we are responsible for engaging new and existing personal customers in digital channels and driving sales via online/mobile banking and nordea.se. We are building the omnichannel customer journey experience and for that we need to connect different data sources across our platforms and applications. Right product, right process, right message, right channel, at the right time for the right customer.
   

  

 The role is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 We are looking for a curious and driven Senior Data Scientist that will be a crucial part of implementing our strategy connected to omnichannel customer journey experience. Someone who is comfortable working on their own or as part of team to support Personal Banking (business stakeholders).
   

  

 You will enable Digital Sales to use the power of data and analytics to create the omnichannel experience. Providing insights and recommendations, driving intelligent automation by applying model-based solutions, simplification of processes, and identifying new data sources to our marketing automation tools. You will collaborate with the team to develop our data into advanced AI models, predicting customer's future needs and behaviour in digital channels.
   

  

**In addition you will be:**
* Analysing how our omnichannel business is developing including e.g. sales, activity performance, customer behaviour, pricing, process steps and demand
* Designing and developing customer engagement activities: suggest target group, evaluate data availability, support utilizing sufficient control groups, monitor the outcome of activities, and evaluate the results
* Participating actively in the work of digital customer journey teams, training and coaching the team to utilize data & analytics
* Enabling data for analytics, reporting and marketing automation tool(s)
* Recommending and performing analysis of different data sources to spot development trends and pain points
* Together with a wider data analyst community and take part into building analytics & tools needed for business development


**Who You Are**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. We are looking for someone that loves working with data and analytics - someone who can look at all kinds of data and see meaning, insights, ideas, opportunities and elevate analysis and strategic thinking to support the team in delivering the best customer experiences. You have the skills and mindset to take ownership of the whole spectrum of data science: data gathering, cleaning, engineering, and modelling, while taking the business perspective into account.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you are/have:**
* Interest in business and customer behaviour
* Good at collaboration in practice - work closely with other SMEs (Subject Matter Experts), involve stakeholders and always asking questions and investigating alternative solutions
* Can drive tasks on your own but equally skilled in facilitating collaboration around tasks while maintaining the customer centric mindset
